loans.name: Allen's Group

texts.en: N. Allen is a hard working and determined lady. She is 31 years old and married with 5 children aged between 14 – 4 years as she takes care of her own siblings. She is involved in the sale of produce that she gets from the farmers in the villages and she sells from Namataba trading centre. Because of the use of her loans, she is able to inject in more money that help to make 100,000/= as profits a week out of the quality products that she buys. She vies to become a whole sale supplier of farm produce so that she could be able to make more money as well as educating her children to the University level. Allen needs a loan to help buy more produce for her business as well as complete payment of her children’s fees in time.

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale so as to make more profits.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
T. Beatrice is an ambitious entrepreneur with a food store. Her shop is located along Bundibugyo Road in Kisenyi (Rwengoma A2 Zone). She started with little capital in 2007, that is, a few bags of maize and cassava. As the business went on, slowly, she took the maize and cassava for grilling and the stock increased with maize flour and cassava flour. Further, she added millet flour due to the fact that it is jointly demanded with cassava flour as a mixture for a meal.

Beatrice is requesting the loan to add inventory and include beans in her business since people love them as a sauce for meals. And more so in the rainy season, the prices tend to increase which may affect her profits, so she wants to stock up in advance, that is, purchase maize, millet, cassava, and beans in large quantity for her business expansion. Her dream is to see her business be successful.

loans.use: To purchase maize, millet, cassava, and beans in volume

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 49-year-old local restaurant operator. She is divorced and is blessed with one child who has currently traveled abroad.

In her restaurant, Gladys prepares and serves local foods like "fufu" and "banku." Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and taken with all kinds of soup; banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is taken with hot pepper or soup. Gladys has been in business for the past twenty years now. She also sells foodstuffs like yam, maize and palm nuts to generate additional income to support herself and her family.

Gladys says the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditures. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, firewood, and other foodstuffs.

Gladys dreams of buying a brand new deep-freezer to enable her to freeze her leftover meats and fish, etc. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for her restaurant

loans.name: Rustamhon

texts.ru: Рустамхон Гаюров проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 44 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Рустамхон по специальности "фотограф". Он более 20 лет работает в фотосалоне "фотографом". Кредит просит для покупки нового фотоаппарата, чтобы предоставлять качественные услуги.
texts.en:
Rustamhon G. lives in the city of Kulob. He's forty-four years old, married and has four children. Rustamhon has worked as a photographer for more than twenty years in a photo studio. He is asking for a loan in order to buy a new camera with which he could provide better quality services.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new camera

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia A. is from the village of Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Delia is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a footwear store and sells to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2006, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Delia is requesting another loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and as working capital. This loan will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Inventory and working capital

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda D. is from the village of Mamanga Gamay. She is 55 years old. Luzminda is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Luzminda owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2000, Luzminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase new items to sell. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Luzminda's 13th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy items to sell and to use as working capital

loans.name: Togmid

texts.en:
Togmid is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter, 17, is in college while the youngest, 5, is in kindergarten.

With the help of his wife, Togmid operates a business selling secondhand shoes out of a shipping container at a local market. He began his business in 2004 after working in a mining company for several years.

Togmid is planning to continue to maintain his business for the future. He says, "My dream is to find a proper jobs for my children and to help them to better their quality of life."

Togmid is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase shoes for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more used shoes

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan Antonio G. de 47 años edad, reside en el municipio de Ciudad Arce, en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su madre, la cual se dedica a los oficios del hogar, su padre quien trabaja como jornalero y una sobrina quien se dedica a estudiar. Juan Antonio posee una venta de repuestos para vehículos, la cual está ubicado sobre la calle principal de Ciudad Arce, lo cual es de mucho Beneficio para su negocio, debido a que está a la vista de todos los conductores. El negocio de venta de repuestos para automóviles ha sido muy fructifico para Juan, ya que gracias a este, ha podido brindarle estabilidad económica a su familia, así mismo ha contado con la capacidad de pagarle los estudios a su sobrina. Juan Antonio, solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir más en su negocio comprando accesorios y repuestos para  vehículos tales como, bujías, frenos, filtros para aire y aceite y otros más. Para él, el bienestar de su familia es primero, es por esto que desea mejorar las ganancias de su negocio, debido a que uno de sus mayores anhelos es poder brindar toda la seguridad y estabilidad económica que su hogar necesita.
texts.en:
47-year old Juan Antonio G. lives in the municipality of Arce in La Libertad department. He lives with his mother who looks after the home, his father who works as a day labourer, and his niece who is a student. Juan Antonio owns a business selling spare parts for vehicles. It is located in the main street of Arce, a really beneficial location as it can easily be seen by motorists. According to Juan the business has done well so he has been able to provide financial stability for his family and also pay his niece’s educational expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy accessories and spare parts such as spark plugs, brakes, air and oil filters, and other items. The wellbeing of his family is the most important thing for Juan and so he wants to increase the income from his business. One of his greatest wishes is to be able to provide all the security and financial stability that his family needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spare parts for vehicles

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Adrian Jhonny

texts.es: Adrian cuenta con 50 años de edad, está casado pero actualmente su esposa no se encuentra con él porque ella trabaja en el sector de salud fuera de la ciudad. Ambos tienen dos hijos de los cuales uno está trabajando en España y el otro aun vive con ellos. La familia cuenta con casa propia. Adrian tiene su propio taxi y trabaja de lunes a sábado en el mismo, ocasionalmente también trabaja en el sector de la construcción. Según lo que indica Adrian la competencia en su rubro es fuerte pero él tiene experiencia y no tiene problemas con la oferta de sus servicios. El destino del crédito es para la compra de llantas y para pagar el saldo que tiene en Agrocapital. Se considera a Adrian como un cliente con un comportamiento normal, tuvo algunos retrasos debido a que se arruino su automóvil, en las demás cuotas demostró ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Adrian is 50 years old, he is married but his wife does not currently live with him because she works in the health sector outside the city. They have two children, one who lives in Spain and the other who still lives with them. The family has its own house. Adrian has his own taxi and works Monday to Saturday doing this and occasionally he also works in the construction sector. According to Adrian the competition in his industry is fierce but he has experience and does not have any problems offering his services. The loan is to be used for the purchase of tires and to pay the balance that he has with Agrocapital. Adrian is considered to be a customer with normal payment patterns, he had some delays due to his car being damaged, in his other instalments he proved to be responsible in his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE OF TIRES AND PAYMENT OF AGROCAPITAL BALANCE

loans.name: Mrs. Uok Mom Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has seventeen people who live in Trapeang Angk village in Takeo province. Mrs. Uok M. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members; they will use their loans for different purposes. She is a weaver in the local village. She is a widow who lives with five dependents in her household. However hard she works, she can only earn a little income. Thus, in order to improve family living conditions, Mrs. Uok M. decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk for weaving. All the members of the group are shown in the picture, but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy more silk for weaving

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase young chickens and feed

loans.name: Mbithe

texts.en: Mbithe is 28 years old and married with two children who go to school. She sells charcoal to her neighbors. She has been in this business for two years. She also keeps animals for commercial purposes to earn enough money to provide for her family and pay school fees for her children. She had previously taken out a loan from Faulu Kenya, which she used to expand her business, and she successfully repaid it. She hopes to grow her business and start her own school in the future. She has requested for a loan to add more charcoal for sale.

loans.use: To add stock of charcoal

loans.name: An's Group

texts.en:
A. An T. D. is 27 years-old. She is married with two children. She lives in Luc Canh village, Dong Anh district, Ha Noi. She is a farmer and also sells vegetables in the market. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She felt happy when she joined Kiva partner SEDA because she can save money every week. She has been with SEDA for three years and always repays her loans punctually. She is a group leader. In this credit cycL., she repuests a loan of 5,014,000 VND in order to expand her business.

There are two other members in her group.  Hien T. N. is 24 years-old and a pig breeder.  She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for pigs.   Dao T. L. is 29 years-old and she wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Huaquillay Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. ROSA OFELIA, TIENE 63 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES CASADA, SU PESPOSO LA APOYA EN TODOS LOS RETOS QUE ELLA SE PROPONGA, TIENEN CUATRO HIJOS MAYORES DE EDAD.ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "SANTA ROSA DE HUAQUILLAY", INTEGRADO POR NUEVE PERSONAS, SUS VECINAS, ELLAS SON RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO DE COMAS.
HACE NUEVE AÑOS, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA, INICIÓ COMO AMBULANTE CON POCOS PRODUCTOS, IVA VISITANDO DE CASA EN CASA, LUEGO SE ANIMÓ A CRECER Y PAGAR EL ALQUILER DE UN PUESTO EN EL MERCADO DE SU ZONA.
CON SU TRABAJO HA LOGRADO HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO, AUMENTAR SU STOCK Y ASUMIR SUS GASTOS PERSONALES.
SU PROXIMA META SERÁ CONSEGUIR SU PROPIO LOCAL.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZARÁ PARA COMPRAR MÁS MERCADERÍA.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Ofelia, age 63, is married. Her husband supports her in all the challenges she faces. They have four grown children.

She is a member of the Santa Rosa de Huaquillay group, which consists of 9 people who are her neighbors. They are residents of the Comas district.

For nine years, Sra. Rosa has been involved with the sale of beauty products. She began selling a few products on an itinerant basis, going from house to house. Later, she got the courage to enlarge her business and paid to rent a stall in the market in her area. Her work has succeeded in making her business grow. She has added to her stock and met her personal expenses.

Her next goal is to get her own shop. The loan applied for will be used for the purchase of more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of beauty products.

loans.name: Rukarara Development Group B, Kihihi

texts.en:
This very determined and hardworking lady is not afraid of diversity when speaking in economic business terms and anything that can earn her profit. K. Suzan, aged 31 years, is happily married with five children and has been in the produce business for one month.

Suzan opened up her grocery, dealing in dry food crops like peas, beans, maize, millet and sorghum, and this loan is to help her buy more stock for resale. This is because she did not have a sound capital base in the beginning. The loan will give her a free ticket to earn more revenue and cater for her family’s basic needs and also acquire a self-sustaining life.

loans.use: To buy more peas, beans, maize, millet and sorghum to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida M. is from the city of Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 48 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Aida cooks and sells food for daily meals in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $770 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Aida is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rahmat's Group

texts.en:
Rahmat lives in a small city called Vehari, which is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. Her husband’s name is A. S. and he owns a scrap shop in the market. She has a son who helps his father in his scrap business.

Rehmat is a very supportive lady. She helps her family financially with her domestic-sewing business. Her clientele base is her neighbors. She receives order from them and earns reasonable charges.

Rehmat is applying for a loan from Asasah for her husband who wants to buy more scrap material for his business. She is very sure that by making an investment in her husband’s business, he will be able to increase his income which will be used to enhance her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To enable her husband to purchase more scrap for his scrap business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn B. is from the village of Tinabalan, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Marilyn is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Marilyn makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 6,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. Marilyn is the one who manages the small stall, while her husband is the baker. In 2009, Marilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the third loan taken out by Marilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Potential Women Group

texts.en:
Patricia J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Potential Women. Patricia is 32 years old, single, and has five children who range from five to 15 years old. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. She cares for three siblings. For 16 years, she has been selling dried fish on Water Street, downtown Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more fish. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. Her dream is to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more fish.

loans.name: Karim Patricia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es  la Sra. Karim;  Ella tiene 37 años de edad,  es separada y tiene 2 hijos,  se dedica al comercio minorista, La socia vende trotas y kekes, ella elabora las tortas y los diferentes kekes y los reparte en diferentes zonas al por mayor para luego ir a cobrar  La socia necesita el capital de trabajo para preparar las tortas en los próximos días.  La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de insumos e ingredientes para la preparación de tortas y kekes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the “Patron de Santiago de Santiago” communal bank. This bank is located in the Santiago district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco. The borrower’s name is Karim. She is 37 years old, separated and has two children. Her activity is the retail commerce of pastries and various cakes which she distributes in several areas at wholesale prices, to be collected at a later date. The borrower needs working capital to prepare pastries in the coming days. She is requesting a loan she will use to purchase material and ingredients for the preparation of pastries and cakes. The borrower appreciates and values the loan, and accordingly she is committed to making her payments in a disciplined manner according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of material and ingredients to prepare pastries and cakes.

loans.name: Paula Maura

texts.es:
Paula Maura es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Echave” desde hace seis  años, pertenece al distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 60 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con  grado de instrucción primaria (incompleta), tiene cinco hijos,  solo uno depende de ella.
Paula Maura tiene una empresa de transporte de servicio urbano, que viene  trabajando desde hace muchos años. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró  repuestos para un carro.
Ella solicitará  un nuevo crédito de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles para comprar llantas y repuestos.    
Su visión es aumentar más carros  para servicio público y carga. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los ahorros y la solidaridad.
texts.en:
Paula Maura has been a member of the community bank named Victor Echave for the past six years. She lives together with her boyfriend and she did not complete primary school. She has five children and only one of them still lives at home. Paula Maura has a public transport company. She has had the business for many years now. The first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) was in the amount of 300 nuevos soles and with it she purchased spare parts for her cab. She requests a new loan in the amount of 3000 nuevos soles to purchase tires and spare parts. Her dream is to expand her fleet of taxi cabs and moving trucks. She most enjoys the savings programs and support system in the community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tire and spare parts for her taxi.

loans.name: Milca

texts.es: La Señora  Milca vive en casa de sus padres es soltera no tiene ni un hijo como todos los microempresarios ella comenzó a trabajar con caramelos de una marca muy conocida, como promotora, conoció al dueño y tiene buena amistad con el,  la señora saca dulces al por mayor de  menor precio y ella lo vende un poco mas caro, tiene bastantes proveedores especialmente de tiendas de barrio ya que fue conocida cuando era promotora de el trabajo que tenia ahora saco el crédito para poder comprar mas caramelos ya que tiene bastantes pedidos y tiene mucha clientela es mas conocida en el mercado del lugar donde ella vive, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Milca lives with her parents, is single with no children. As many other micro-business owners, she started working with a well know brand of candies as a promoter. She got to know the owner and has a good relationship with him. She gets the candy at wholesale prices and sells it at higher retail prices. She has many dealers in neighborhood stores that know her from the times that she was a promoter. She is requesting the loan to purchase more candy since she has many orders and many customers. She is well know in the area where she lives. She is very grateful to the institution for their support in granting her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Celia Maritza

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

La señora Celia tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil casada, de esta relación ha tenido seis  hijos ya todos mayores de edad, tres de ellos viven con ella además de una nieta que es como su hija, dos de sus hijos estudian en la Universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella es comerciante, tiene una pequeña distribuidora de productos de primera necesidad, también vende artículos de bazar y papelería y en su local tiene unas cabinas telefónicas, nos cuenta que su negocio es su vida dice que empezó con una pequeña tiendita y que ahora gracias a su trabajo y dedicación a logrado crecer mucho, trabaja durante todo el día desde las 7an hasta las 18h00 que cierra su negocio, por los peligros existentes en la zona.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar una copiadora que le hace falta a su negocio, es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal es la secretaria y le gusta por las charlas informativas.
 
Su meta es tener un local mucho más amplio.
texts.en:
In the locality of Cadi, in Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo---a place known for its hard-working people dedicated to agriculture and cattle raising---the members of the Nueva Ilusion (New Dream) Communal Bank gather every 15 days.

Celia is 45 years old, married, and has had 6 children, all of whom are now adults. Three still live with her, plus a granddaughter who is like another daughter. Two of her children study in the University. Her husband works in agriculture.

Celia is a merchant and has a small distributorship of products of prime necessity.  She also sells products in general and school supplies, stationary, etc.  In addition, she has some telephone boxes. 

Celia says that her store is her life.  She began with a tiny store and, now, thanks to her efforts and dedication, she has managed to grow considerably.  Celia works all day from 7:00am until 6:00pm, when she closes her business, due to the dangers present in the zone.

This loan will be used to buy a copying machine which her business lacks.  Celia is a founding member of her communal bank, and currently serves as its secretary. She especially likes the informative discussions at the bank.

Celia's  goal is to have a much larger store space.

loans.use: BUYING A COPY MACHINE FOR HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina M. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Selina is 37 years old and is married to a farmer. She has one child and her child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa C. is from the village of Trigos, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Elsa is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. Elsa has been engaged in her business for one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2007, Elsa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Elsa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Used to purchased fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Lun K., 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. K. is a housewife while her husband is employed at a private company, earning an income of about USD 11 per day. K. has to spend USD 30 on food, USD 15 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 55 on other necessary expenses every month.

K. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase vegetables to start a business of selling vegetables. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah W. lives in Kawempe the neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, four of whom are in school.  Sarah has a hardware business. She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days out of every week. Sarah sells her products in a retail shop. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of cement, iron sheets and pangas (machete blades). The main business challenges for Sarah include thieves and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own another shop in Bwaise. Sarah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement, iron sheets and pangas (machete blades)

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 23 years old supporting a family of three members. He is married to Emily Chemwotei and together they have two children aged 5 years and 3 years. He does farming and he has been in business for four years and right now his monthly income from the business is Kshs 5,000.

He has now borrowed Kshs 20,000 which he is planning to use to purchase goats and open a butchery where he will be selling meat. He plans to use the anticipated profits from the business will be used to purchase more goats for slaughter and to expand the business. This is his third loan and he paid his previous loan successfully. 

Benson hopes are to have a satisfying business in life and to start a business for his spouse.

loans.use: To purchase more goats and open a butchery.

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is a mother of five daughters and four sons. She has a farm where she raises goats and honeybees. Majeda started her business few years ago and took loans from FATEN to expand it

Majeda came to FATEN and took a loan to purchase another goat and honeycomb boxes in order to increase the number of goats and honey production.

Majeda is a committed borrower and a successful woman from Bethlehem.

Majeda appears in the picture here wearing a protection suit while taking care of her bees with one of the employees.

loans.use: To purchase a goat and honeycomb boxes

loans.name: Letecia Cartajenas Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Letecia C. is 55 years old, married and lives in Stimson Abordo, Ozamiz City. She leads a two-person loan group affiliated with PMPC. While each member gets an individual loan, both are responsible for paying back the entire loan if the other member is delinquent or defaults.

Letecia's husband makes a living driving a truck. They have five children, all of them grown. Five years ago, Letecia joined Paglaum MPC as a way to improve her life and ability to engage in business. She will use her 14,000 PHP portion of this new loan, her third, for truck maintenance and franchising. She will use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions, set aside some savings and continue expanding her small business. 

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. 
About Group Loans
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: Truck maintenance and franchising

location.town: Ozamis-Stimson Abordo, Ozamiz City Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie A. is 42 years old, married and has five school-aged children. She is from the village of Hasaan in the municipality of Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental province in the Mindanao islands. Elsie is a photographer who provides her services to local community members. Elsie has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase photography supplies. Elsie is requesting a new loan, her seventh from PMPC, of 7,000 PHP that will be used to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her photography business

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es: La Sra. Mirtha  D. 51 años D. edad casada  hace 20 años tiene cinco hijos actualmente solo vive con uno, vive en casa propia en el barrio San Antonio zona pampa D. la isla. La Sra. Mirtha se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes hace 30 años, El dinero que solicito en la institución es para la compra D. mercadería (azúcar arroz aceite dulces verduras u otros)  La clienta quedo muy agradecida por la confianza depositada en su persona y por la atención que recibió D. parte del personal D. la agencia, ya que ella es una persona amable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Sra. Mirtha is 51 years old and has been married for twenty years. She has five children, but only one of them currently lives with her. Mirtha has her own home in the San Antonio neighborhood of the District of Pampa D. La Isla. She has been selling groceries for thirty years. The money she is requesting from Emprender will be used to buy merchandise such as sugar, rice, sweets, vegetables, and other items.

Sra. Mirtha is very grateful for the trust being shown to her and the personal attention she has received from the staff of Emprender. She is a friendly and hardworking person.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise in bulk

loans.name: Rosa Angelica Kelma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa Angélica; la socia tiene 61 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia tiene su propio hotel el cual ya tiene varios años trabajando en el sector turismo, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante ya que su hotel le a traído varias satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia un tiene algunos proyectos para seguir mejorando su hotel y la calidad de servicio que brinda.

La socia solicita el préstamo para su uso personal y para algunos detalles que necesita su hotel.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosa Angélica is a member of the Communal Bank “Patron San Sebastian” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 61 years old, married, and has three children. Rosa owns a hotel and has several years of experience in the tourism industry. She is a cheerful individual who is eager to move forward. Her hotel has given her financial as well as personal satisfaction. Rosa is undertaking a few projects to improve her hotel and the quality of service she provides.

The loan she is requesting will be used for a few details that are needed in her hotel, as well as some personal expenses. Rosa is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: Pay for improvements to her hotel & some personal expenses

loans.name: Ryskan's Group

texts.ru:
Рыскан Чимиянова,46, лидер этой группы. Услышав о замечательной возможности, предоставляемой Кивой, она немедленно поделилась этой информацией со своими коллегами. Сразу же образовалась группа единомышленников, которые нуждались в кредите. Чтобы найти применение своим умениям и стремлению работать на пользу себе и другим. Рыскан, мать четверых детей с заработной платой технички в 800 сомов начала свой бизнес 4 года назад с покупки одной козы. Рыскан совместными усилиями с мужем и 12-летним сыном достигли результата в 2 500 сомов месячной прибыли и увеличения поголовья коз до 20 голов. Рыскан хватает времени , навыков и сил, чтобы управиться с таким большим хозяйством. Она уверена что это еще не предел. С этой целью она и обратилась за кредитом. Рыскан хотела бы закупить дополнительно живности. 


        --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.
texts.en:
Ryskan C. is 46 years old, the leader of this group. When she heard of the wonderful opportunity provided by Kiva she has immediately shared this information with her colleagues. The group of like minded people who needed a loan was formed at once to find use for their skills and to work rapidly for their own and others benefit.

Ryskan is a mother of four children with a technician's income of 800 soms. She started her business four years ago with the purchase of one goat. Ryskan together with her husband and their twelve year old son have achieved results of 2500 soms of monthly income and increased the head count of goats by 20 heads. Ryskan has the time, skills and strength to take care of such a large household. She is positive that this is not the limit. She is asking for a loan with this purpose. Ryskan wants to buy more livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Tasali

texts.en:
Tasali is a 43-year-old woman, divorced and mother of two, working in a beauty institute. She lives in Beirut and specializes in facial treatments, tattoos, make-up and massages. Her customers consider her an honest woman providing good services, as she has considerable experience in the field. She has certificates from Canada but encountered financial problems when she opened her business. 

She is working hard to provide her children with the best education and a secure living and hopes to continue offering them the best living conditions possible. In the future she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a machine to clean facial skin.

loans.name: Dario

texts.es:
Dario tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero y reside en el sector Calera, una zona rural que tiene como actividad principal a la agricultura y que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Reque, a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace más de10 años, el cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo con el que cuenta, adicionalmente ayuda a su madre a conducir el manejo de unos terrenos agrícolas de su propiedad.

Dario desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Dario is 29 years old.  He is single and lives in Calera sector.  This is a rural area whose inhabitants mainly work in agriculture.  It is located in Reque district, forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Dario has been farming for more than 10 years.  He owns a small plot of farmland and also helps his mother to manage some farmland that she owns.

Dario would like to acquire fertilizers to maintain his crop.  In this way, he hopes to obtain a good harvest.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur B. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a house in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Her husband manages a bag-trading business at a local market. Her older son is a student while the younger one is a pupil. 

Gantumur manages a clothing-making business at her rented workshop. She started her business in 2000 and has managed to stabilize it. Before her business operation, she worked as a nurse and as a tailor for several years. Now she is well known and well respected among her customers. 

Her working capital has reached 1,000,000 MNT with daily earning of 30,000 MNT. She is a diligent woman who says, "My husband and I work hard in order to feed my children. So we lack time to spend with our children." 

She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase materials used in making clothes in order to sell them during the time of student graduation paries.

loans.use: To purchase materials used in making clothes.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine is 46 years old and has two children who are 20 and 19 years old. One of her children is still in a student, and her husband makes a living by selling food items. Valentine also sells food, including rice, beans and maize flour, but in a different location from her husband. She has been in this business for 14 years, and her work has allowed her to pay her children's school fees. She is applying for a loan to buy more food to sell. She hopes to make enough money to continue paying fees for the one child she still has in school.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert has been practicing farming in Narok for the last 5 years. He is 25 years old, single and supports his parents. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and is applying for his third loan. He has repaid his first two loans fully and on time. He plans to use this loan to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting. In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in Narok town.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: "gye Nyame" Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Yaa describes herself as a neat and hardworking woman. She is a 39-year-old mother of four children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Yaa is currently the group leader of “Gye Nyame” Trust Bank. She is a petty trader who has been selling smoked fish and hides for the past twenty years. Smoked fish is a locally roasted fresh fish to make it more flavorsome for the preparation of soups and sauces. She also engages in farming as her second business to make extra income. 

She is excited to be receiving the loan, which she plans to invest into purchasing more cartons of fresh fish to smoke and serve her customers. She anticipates increasing her profit level and also expanding her market. Yaa hopes to increase her savings to buy a piece of land to start building a house to accommodate her family.

The other members of Yaa’s group are traders and service providers.  As the leader of the group, she ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh fish.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La apreciable señora Carmen es una persona  responsable  y  muy  trabajadora que se dedica al comercio desde hace ya  hace  mas  de un año, ella  tiene   una  tienda  de  abarrotes  que   actualmente  la  tiene  en su  domicilio y   junto  a  su  esposo   atienden  su   negocio, en esta  ocasión  requieren  de nuestra ayuda para   realizar la compra  de mercancía    ya que  ellos  desean   invertir  en  un  mayor  numero de productos  para    poder   ofrecer a  sus  clientes un  mejor servicio,  estan  muy  agradecidos por   el  apoyo  brindado  para la realización de su proyecto   ya  que  este  negocio  representa  una de  las  maneras  en las  que  obtienen  sus ingresos   para  sacar  adelante   a  sus  tres  pequeños  los  cuales  son lo  mas importante  en su  vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen is a responsible and hardworking woman who has run her business for more than a year. She has a grocery store which she currently runs from her home. Both she and her husband help with the store. 

They are now asking for our help so they can buy a wider variety of merchandise so they have a better range to offer their customers. They are very grateful for this support, as their store represents one of the ways they earn money to help their three young children get ahead in life. The children are the most important part of their lives.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 34 years old, married and has three children aged between one and five years old. He operates a general store where he sells sugar, flour, tea leaves, cooking oil, beverages and detergents. The business has been in existence for five years and he says it is profitable. Fredrick plans to use this loan to purchase more general items, which he intends to resell.
In the future, Fredrick hopes to grow his business to wholesale. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, flour, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Ileine Luisa

texts.es:
Ileine vive en el municipio de Malambo, área metropolitana de la ciudad de Barranquilla a 5 kilómetros del aeropuerto de la ciudad, contiguo a las poblaciones de Soledad, Sabanagrande y Santo Tomás, lo cual hace de su composición social sea muy especial, debido a que en sus habitantes encontramos una mezcla gente de todo el país,  que llega a trabajar de manera independiente mediante un negocio o  en El Parque Industrial Malambo S.A. -PIMSA- condominio industrial privado de completa infraestructura de servicios, orientados a garantizar reducciones en los costos a las empresas que se ubiquen en sus instalaciones y que tienen garantizada la disponibilidad suficiente de mano de obra a las empresas de la zona.  
En este ambiente tiene su negocio de vender celulares y accesorios para ellos, donde tambien ofrece el servicio de reparaciòn y mantenimiento de estos equipos, en compañia de su conyuge quien tiene conocimientos de electrónica y de su hijo de 3 meses de nacido. 
Este negocio lo iniciò un cuñado  de Ileine hace 7 años y se lo vendiò a esta pareja, con el fin de apoyarles en la generaciòn de sus propios ingresos para el sostenimiento de su naciente hogar, sus padres tambien los apoyaron con el primer capital y desde allì lograron salir adelante con sus estudios de educaciòn superior. Su meta y gran desafio es conseguir construír de prosperidad en su negocio, para lograr una educación de calidad para su hijo. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará celulares modernos, carcasas, herramientas de reparaciòn y vitrinas para la exhibición apropiada de sus productos. Su sueño mas adelante es tener un local nuevo y bien posicionado y terminar de estudiar porque este es justamente su gran desafio.
texts.en:
Ileine lives in Malambo, a metropolitan area within the city of Barranquilla, five km from the airport.  It’s contiguous with the cities of Soledad, Sabanagrande, and Santo Tomás.  This makes the social composition very special because here we find a mix of people from all over the country.  They all work either on their own or at the Malambo Inc – PIMSA – Industrial Park, a private industry complex with a complete infrastructure of services designed to lower costs for the businesses located within its installations.  They also provide guaranteed labor to the zone’s companies.

Here she and her husband sell cell phones and accessories and also repair and maintain this equipment.  Her husband knows electronics.  They also have a three month old son.

Ileine’s father in law started this business seven years ago and sold it to this couple in order to help them generate their own income so that they could support their household.  Her parents also helped them with their initial capital and since then they have managed to get ahead with their higher education.  Her goal and great challenge is to prosper in her business, so that they can provide a quality education to their son.  This Kiva loan will be the first she receives through “Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo” and she will use the money to buy newer model cell phones, carriers, repair tools, and display cases to show their products.  Her dream is to have a new, well-positioned storefront and complete her studies.  This is certainly a great challenge.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and inventory.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 43 years old and married with 2 children, ages 12 and 17. She runs a rice store in Kissy near Freetown. Her spouse is a teacher. Fatmata and her spouse take care of one relative as well as their immediate families. 

Fatmata sells rice, sugar and oil at her store. She has owned this business for 13 years and says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation of food stuff. Fatmata also earns income from renting out a house. 

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more bags of rice, oil and sugar. Fatmata says that the extra income from this loan will help her immensely in taking care of herself and family. In the future, she would like to sell goods on wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice, oil and sugar.

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa is 36 years old, married and has five children. Epenesa works in her business, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has one year of experience in this business. Epenesa needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase farming equipment such as knives, spade and wheel-barrow. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 360 talas or US $150 per week) to expand her business.

Epenesa joined SPBD in 2011 in order to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Epenesa's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment such as knives, spade and wheel-barrow.

loans.name: Zaituna

texts.ru:
Зайтуна очень хорошая и порядочная женщина. Она вдова и у неё один ребенок Она сама занимается купля продажей продукты питания более 4 года. Она любить свою работу и с удовольствием занимается этим. Её торговая точка находится возле своего дома и её систра помогает ей в данном бизнесе. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хороший прибыль для того чтобы она могла содержать своего ребенка и обеспечить его. Она хочет устроит своего ребенка в садик, чтобы он вырос умным и воспитанным ребенком.  Зайтуна хотела бы получит кредит в размере 3000$ США для покупки нового ассортимента продукты питания. Она надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать её. 

 More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Zaituna is a very good and decent woman.  She is a widow and has one child.  She has been involved in buying and selling food products for over four years.  She loves her work and does it with satisfaction.  Her retail outlet is located near her home, and her sister helps her in this business.  Zaituna wants to expand her business and make a good profit in order to support her child and provide for him.  She wants to place her child into a kindergarten, so that he grows up to become a smart and well-mannered person.  Zaituna wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of a new assortment of food products.  She hopes that the creditors will support her.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Julia Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 24 De Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Julia es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta la ayuda que le han brindado en el tiempo que lleva en el Banco Comunal. Tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero uno de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es albañil.

Nuestra amiga se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado, todas las mañanas sale de su casa y se acerca a las embarcaciones que llegan de alta mar, luego de bajar el pescado ella les compra el pescado por gavetas a los pescadores para después llevarlos a vender por toda la localidad, trabaja todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 15h00, lleva más de 12 años dedicada a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pescado para la a venta.

Su sueño es tener buena salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
The “24 de Diciembre” communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are known both nationally and internationally; it’s the place where the famous straw hats come from.

Julia, 49, is a founding member of the bank and she likes the help she’s gotten during the time she’s been in the communal bank.  She’s married and has two children who are adults now but one of them still lives with her.  Her husband’s a bricklayer.

Our friend is a fish merchant.  She leaves home every day and goes up to the fishing boats that arrive from the high seas.  When the fish is unloaded she buys it from the fishermen by the lockerful to then go sell it throughout her community.  She works every day from 5am until 3pm.  She’s been in this business for over 12 years and she’s done very well.

This loan is to buy fish to resell.  Her dream is for herself and her loved ones to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Ana has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Ana has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Ana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Sadaan's Group

texts.en:
Sadaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her son’s milk and yogurt selling business. He operates his shop in the market from where he provides fresh, quality milk and yogurt to his customers. He has contacts with different milk sellers who provide milk to him early in the morning on daily basis. He prepares yogurt from it and sells it at a profit to his customers. 
He is new in this business: he started it only a year ago. Sadaan is hopeful that an investment will help her son establish his business and increase his profits. 
Sadaan herself is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and receives regular orders every month. Besides her work, she also performs her household duties very well. 

Sadaan is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

loans.use: To buy milk for her son's youghurt and milk selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy winter clothes to supply her business

loans.name: Maro

texts.en:
Maro is from the village of Breta in the Kartli region of East Georgia. She is 63 years old and lives in the village with her husband Gabriel. The family earns a living through agriculture. They own 1.3 hectares of land, where they grow maize, beans, tomato and onion. Maro and Gabriel sell harvested products locally to green-grocery retailers. Their family's total average monthly income is 540 Laris. 

Maro requested credit for purchasing fuel for a tractor to till the land. As she takes good care of the land, she can count on a good harvest next season. A small part of the credit will also be used for purchasing wood for her oven, as it is the only mean of heating the house during the winter months in Maro’s village.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for a tractor for tilling land and wood for an oven for heating the house

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 51 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in Uganda. She is married and has four children with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, Christine has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells drinks like soda, beer and spirits to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more crates of drinks, and it will help Christine to generate greater profits and improve her family's social and economical status. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her bar so that it also includes a depot. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of drinks.

loans.name: Rudelyn

texts.en:
Rudelyn is a 31-year-old single woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has a 6-year-old child.

Rudelyn buys and sells fresh fish. She rents a stall at the market to sell fish. She also sells dried sea cucumbers. Rudelyn requested this loan to buy an icebox and more fish to sell. Rudelyn hopes that her business will grow. She also hopes to save for her child’s education.

loans.use: to buy an icebox and more fish to sell

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo de 24 años de edad casado con Elva de 24 años de edad, fruto de esta relación tienen un hijo, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en la comunidad de Monterrico del distrito de Sivia. Adolfo es un joven con gran valor y lleno de fuerza para las labores agrícolas. Él recuerda cuando era un niño paso las inclemencias de la pobreza, por los problemas sociales que pasaba el Perú. Esto le sirvió para que él se hiciera fuerte y de frente a los problemas. En la actualidad se dedica al cultivo de café en las alturas de Sivia, donde tiene un excelente clima para éste producto, el café que produce es netamente orgánico que preparado es un delicioso producto, por lo que los grandes acopiadores prefieren comprar su granos por el buen aroma que tiene. Para que el café sea de calidad Adolfo realiza un buen manejo agronómico y dedicación con su cafetales. él está contento por las buenos adquisiciones que hizo gracias a las ventas de café, ahora cuenta con casa propia. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete otra vez en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos contratará peones para que limpien y saquen la maleza de su campo agrícola.
texts.en:
Adolfo is 24 years old, married to 24 year old Elva and they have a son.  They live in a home of their own, located in the Monterrico community of the Sivia district.  Alvo is a young, courageous man, full of energy for farming.  He recalls when he was poor as a child because of social problems in Peru.  This taught him how to be strong and confront problems.  At the moment he raises coffee in the mountains of Sivia, where the climate is excellent for this product.  He produces organic coffee, which is delicious when prepared, and large suppliers prefer to buy his beans because of their wonderful aroma.

Adolfo manages his plantation well and with great dedication, so that his coffee will be of good quality.  He is happy with the acquisitions he made, thanks to his coffee sales.  Now he has a home of his own.  This will be his third loan through MFP and once again he is committed to making his payments on time.  He will use the 1,000 PEN ($375) from this loan to hire field hands to clean and weed his fields.

loans.use: to hire field hands.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah has been earning her livelihood as a tea farmer for the past 12 years. Located in Kyenjojo, this happy-go-lucky mother of 7 was a nurse prior to starting her business.

With the minimal earnings from her trade, she has done her utmost to give her kids an education, albeit with some difficulty. Leah envisages better and improved circumstances for her business in the forthcoming year, 2012. She says, with better sales returns, she will achieve her dream of giving her kids an education up to the university level. To supplement her income, Leah also has a pharmacy. Monthly, she generates sales revenues to the tune of 450,000 Ugandan shillings.

Leah hopes to use her loan to purchase better manure, fertilizers, and pesticides for her farm.

loans.use: to purchase better manure, fertilizers, and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Anyar Sari 1 Group

texts.en: Like many Balinese women, Ni Wayan and the other members of the Anyar Sari 1 group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families’ incomes.  Though many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize income. Ni Wayan hopes that, through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs.  Ni Wayan will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as fattening pigs.  With her profits, she will help support her family of three by supplementing the income of her husband, who works as a cow breeder.  Ultimately, Ni Wayan hopes that the increased income will enable her to renovate the kitchen.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Tserendavaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Tserendavaa, 38, runs a cafe in the suburban district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She opened her cafe in 2004 and already has her permanent customers who are well satisfied with the quality of her service. Tserendavaa is unmarried and lives with her two daughters in the ger district, a Mongolian traditional nomadic yurt district.
 
She always tries to expand her business with the income from her business. This time she decided to open two karaoke rooms beside her café shop. It is a very beneficial kind of business in the current Mongolian market conditions. At first, she needs to purchase the necessary equipment for the  karaoke rooms. She will buy it from the certified distributor in Mongolia according her plan. The loan she is taking will be to purchase the necessary karaoke room equipment for starting multiple businesses.

loans.use: To purchase karaoke room equipment

loans.name: Mauda

texts.en: Mauda is a widow from Lubiri Mbarara municipality who lost her husband 8 years ago after a long sickness acquired from the bush war that brought the current government to power. After the death of her husband, life became miserable since he was the family's only bread winner. The situation worsened when her in-laws took all the properties she was left with. Later she managed to raise some capital from her friends and started a small retail shop business. This is the same business that feeds her children, pays their school tuitions, as well as meets all the basic needs of the home. She wants to buy more items for selling; this will increase her income and she will be able to pay tuition for her son from the profits. She is hardworking and resilient.

loans.use: to buy stock items to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is an ambitious, 55-year-old lady from the Kirua location, which is a luxuriant banana-producing region in Central province of Kenya. 
With six children to raise, animals to look after and food to cook, Janet, who is an ever-smiling woman of character and goodwill has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs and some personal business that she engages in. 

Janet is seeking a loan worth 100,000 KES from Kiva lenders to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business. Horticulture farming offers employment opportunities to thousands of farmers in the Nkubu area and it’s because of this reason that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Janet access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business. With your loan, Janet’s family will benefit from the growth. This will not only increase their income, but also improve their living standards. Lenders, if there is someone you should consider lending to this festive season, then that person is Janet!

loans.use: To buy seeds and grow her horticulture farming

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, se dedica a vender diferentes bebidas como gaseosas, agua, jugos, etc., hace muchos años atrás él trabajaba en un car wash, luego aprendió el oficio de comerciante y decidió tener su propio negocio, lo fundo hace 19 años, los horarios en que trabaja son de seis de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde o según sea la demanda; Víctor vive junto a su esposa e hijos de 15, 13 y 10 años de edad. Él es el que trabaja para llevar el sustento diario a su familia.
Para tener mercadería almacenada y cubrir con facilidad las demandas de sus clientes, está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en agua, jugos, gaseosas, refrescos, etc., la finalidad de la compra es aprovechar las fiestas patronales y de fin de año para generar más ganancias, espera que las ventas de sus productos se mantengan.
Su visión es lograr mantener su negocio con capital propio y ser un comerciante más reconocido.

loans.use: invertirlo en agua, jugos, gaseosas, refrescos, etc., la finalidad de la compra es aprovechar las fiestas patronales y de fin de año

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Gladys would like to buy shares in the stock market.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.en:
Ana Ruth is married and has three children. Her husband is a laborer whose salary wasn't enough for all of their family's needs. To increase their income Ana began to sell used clothing, but reinvested her profits to purchase new clothing, which she now sells along with shoes. She has had this business for five years and now has a store outside her home.

Ana and her daughter who help her at work have high hopes for their business, for which they need a $200 loan to buy merchandise in order to increase the variety of their inventory and customers. Be a part of this business and grow with Ana. Your contribution will be of much help to Ana and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana Ruth es casada y tiene tres hijos. Su esposo es obrero y la familia tenía muchas necesidades que con el salario de su esposo no podían ser satisfechas. Para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos Ana empezó vendiendo ropa usada, pero reinvertía las utilidades y así pudo cambiar sus productos a ropa nueva y después incorporar la venta de zapatos. Ya son cinco años desde que empezó y ahora ya tiene su establecimiento afuera de su casa.

Son muchos los deseos de superación que tiene Ana y su hija que le ayuda con el negocio, y quieren que su negocio pueda crecer, para lo que necesitan de un préstamo por $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía y así incrementar la variedad de sus productos y sus clientes. Forma parte importante en este negocio, y crece junto con Ana. Tú contribución será de mucha utilidad para Ana y su familia.

loans.use: Purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Boo

texts.en:
Mrs. Boo P. (the woman with the red striped shirt in the photo) is 45 years old and the mother of four children. They live with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a housewife and is a good cook for her family. Her husband, meanwhile, is a soldier and barely makes enough money to supplement the household. To help this, one of her children operates a hairdressing shop where she makes an average of about $11/day. In order to run this business properly, Mrs. P. is asking for a $1000 loan to purchase some hairdressing tools and other equipment to run her daughter's shop. 
In the future, Mrs. P. needs to either expand or own another hairdressing shop which is bigger than this.

loans.use: Mrs. Phov would like to purchase hairdressing tools for a hair salon shop.

loans.name: Akissi

texts.en: D. Akissi Y. is a dynamic and strong 51-year-old woman. She is married and has 7 children. Akissi lives with her family in Koumassi, a township in the southern area of Abidjan. She wholesales various fruits and vegetables in the Koumassi open market. Akissi has been in this business for more than 25 years and is now one the most active fresh vegetable product wholesalers in the Koumassi market. Akissi joined the AE&I microcredit program early 2005 when she heard about it from a friend. She has been very active and has reimbursed all micro loans in a good manner. Akissi want to increase her activities and purchase goods in bulk from production fields.

loans.use: Dje Akissi Yvonne will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is married with three children who all are in primary school. She owns and operates a textile shop specializing in kid’s wear which she has done for the last three years. The shop is located in Kayunga Town. She plans to restock her shop with fast moving kidswear since Christmas is nearing. She is targeting the seasonal market.

loans.use: She wants to buy five bales of children cotton clothing.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben has a well-stocked retail store in the village of Kayunga, and has operated the store for five years. He is married with 6 children. He understands the need for serving his community as he has a strong customer base. Kayunga is a village removed from the larger city of Kampala and stores like Ben’s are needed to make sure that the local villagers have essential food and hygiene items. He tries to stock items that his customers desire including the staples of sugar, soap, posho, rice, and cooking oil.

Ben's future plans are to build a commercial building, both to enlarge his business and to eliminate the paying of rent. For now, he plans to buy more food staples and personal hygiene items for his store with his loan. He has been a borrower in his lending group for the past year and a half and has had no problem repaying past loans.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs such as sugar, soap, maize flour, rice, cooking oil, and personal hygiene items for his retail store.

loans.name: Houn

texts.en: Mrs. Houn K. H., age 49, is a farmer, earning $1 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman, making about $6 each day. They have three children, one who is employed at a garment factory and two who are students. Houn would like to request a loan of $500 in order to purchase a wood house frame and some construction tools for her husband's job. This will expand his business and increase their family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Yanah

texts.en: Yanah, 32, is mother of 3 children. Her husband, A., works as an employee who earns USD95 a month. She sells cloth door-to-door around the village to get extra income, earning USD20 a week. She requests a loan of USD75 to add her business capital and as a member of MBK agrees to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To add to business capital

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 23-year-old single man. He lives and works in the Beirut suburbs. Hassan owns a barber shop. This is the first time Hassan is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He needs US$ 700 to help him renovate his place of business.

loans.use: To renovate his barber shop

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en: Bakhtiyar has 2 years experience as a taxi driver. He was born in 1985, is not married, and he lives in the Khachmaz region. Now he is requesting a loan of $600 to buy the spare parts to maintain his taxi.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Annet Kaweesi's Group

texts.en:
Annet is the leader of the group of five. She lost two of the original members and was joined by other two whose group disintegrated. She is 23 years of age and married with four children. They are aged 10, 7, 5, and 2 years old. Three are all in school. She had never accessed credit until she joined MCDT. The community she lives in is urban within a slum low-lying area.

The main challenge is she works in an open space and sometimes during the rainy season the area floods and the fast running water takes away her stock. In the hot season she has to bear the brunt of the sun.  There is ready market for her business.

Her benefits include being able to take her children to school and contributing to household expenditures. She has over the years acquired a refrigerator, a calf and goat.

She plans to acquire a plot of land to build a house.

Annet is paying her fourth loan.

loans.use: Increasing her stock of charcoal, food and grocery.

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en: Kofi is a proud father of 2 children. He is 35 years old and a married man. He sells cosmetics like roll on, deodorant sprays, face and body powders, etc. Kofi wants to use his loan to buy more boxes of cosmetics to increase his inventory and also to avoid price hikes. He hopes this loan will help increase his income to enable him to rent a store to trade, since he currently hawks his goods. He is a member of the group called Quality. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy boxes of cosmetics

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice A. sells provisions like rice and gari, which is a popular local dish. She is single and her income is not sufficient to support Beatrice and her child.
