Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business selling provisions.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
I have a plot of land that has some construction work on it, but I need to build a room on it because my wife and I are currently living in an old, broken down bus. We do not have any children because of our current living conditions. I am requesting a loan of $800.00 USD in order to obtain at least a safe and steadier roof over our heads so we can sleep.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuento con un terreno semiconstruido, tengo la necesidad de construir un cuarto en el, por que lo que tengo de casa para vivir es un autobús descompuesto, vivo con mi esposa aun no tenemos familia por las condiciones en que nos encontramos, es por esto que les solicito la cantidad de $800.00 dlls. Para poder tener al menos un techo mas firme y seguro donde dormir.

loans.use: Construction of one room

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married and has three children. He lives with his family in Ordzhonikidze. Sergei makes and repairs shoes in a small shop he owns. He started the business 16 years ago. He has gained a reputation for outstanding quality which brings more customers to his shop each day. Presently, he has about $3,000 of turnover capital. His monthly income is about $1,000. 

Sergei would love to see his turnover capital and income increase. He wants to gain firm stability and aims at further development of his enterprise. This time he is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to buy raw materials which would help him realize his goals. Sergei has a perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine and will be able to promptly repay this loan.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty tiene 39 años, vive con sus 2 hijos y su anciano padre. Tiene su bodega desde hace 10 años, su madre, al estar enferma, le traspasó este negocio, el cual viene trabajando intensamente para lograr que su bodega sea una de la que tenga mayor demanda en su zona, para esto a surtido sus estantes de una gran variedad de productos, y la atención esmerada que brinda garantizan sus ventas, por eso, no cesa de atender todos los días su bodega, ya que de eso depende la economía de su hogar.
Betty es el único sostén de su casa, por ello es que se esfuerza tanto.
El préstamo al que accederá será invertido en la compra de mercadería al  por mayor para su tienda.
texts.en:
Betty is 39 years old, and lives with her two children and elderly father. She has had her grocery store for ten years. Her mother, upon getting sick, gave her the business and she has worked tirelessly so that her store is the one in most demand in her area. To do this, she has stocked her store with a great variety of products and provides painstaking attention to her customers in order to guarantee sales. For this reason, she never ceases tending to her store given that she depends on it to support her household. Betty is the sole provider for the family, which is why she puts forth such great effort. The loan would be invested into the purchase of merchandise at wholesale for her store.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise at wholesale for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mrs. Norm Sokhann's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan which consists of nineteen people is located in Preark Roka Village in the Kandal Province. Mrs. Norn S. is the village bank president and was selected by the members. She is a garment factory worker who makes a small salary to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chhun Khom, is a construction worker who earns less than $2 per day. They live in poor conditions. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Norn S. is requesting a loan to buy a calf to start a breeding business. She is 33 years old and the mother of two children one of whom is attending the local school while the four year old stays home. 

Two members in this village loan have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a calf to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris Qurbaov is a 34-year-old trader who sells different foods in a small village in a southern city of Azerbaijan. He has run this business for eight years. Idris also has a car, and sometimes takes local people from his village to the city downtown, but the main income source is his shop. 

Idris is married and has three adorable children. All of his efforts to improve his business are designed to improve the living conditions of his children. 

Now Idris would like to expand his business and purchase more inventory for his shop, such as candies, cookies, mayonnaise, ketchup, sugar, and salt. For this purpose, Idris has applied for a loan of $1200. Your generosity will allow Idris to improve his family's life!

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina M. is 35 years old, married, and a mother of three children. Two of them are in school, while the last born is still breastfeeding. Faustina works very hard because she has the added responsibility of wanting her kids to attend the university some day.

She sells home products like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets, and plates. She sells her products by ‘hawking’, which is door to door sales. Faustina is an achiever and is focused on saving enough money to support her kids in school.

She wants to use the loan to purchase additional plastic materials and kitchen sets to sell to her customers. She would be very grateful for this loan.

Faustina M. is a member of the community group called “Nnown” (meaning song) Group. The members in this group serve as guarantees to one another to access and repay the loans. She does not sell on the days the group meets. Her photo was taken during one of the group meetings.

loans.use: Purchase additional plastic materials and kitchen sets

loans.name: Sandro

texts.es:
El Sr. Sandro Benítez de 29 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Marlene Speratti, ellos tienen una hija de 3 años.
   Don Sandro desde muy joven empezó a trabajar como empleado de un aserradero, él estudiaba y trabajaba al mismo tiempo, así llegó a pagar todos sus estudios ya que su familia es de escasos recursos, el estudió la carrera de mecánica dental, que es la profesión que está ejerciendo en la actualidad, gracias a la calidad de sus trabajos y a la buena atención que él les ofrece ya tiene una clientela que concurre a su consultorio  constantemente.
   El Sr. Sandro, utilizaría este crédito para comprar un sillón odontológico, lo cual le servirá para seguir mejorando su servicio.
texts.en:
Mr. Sandro Benítez is 29 years old, married to Mrs. Marlene Speratti, and they have a 3 year old daughter. Sandro began to work as an employee in a sawmill at a young age. He used to study and work at the same time, and in this way was able to pay all his studies as his family had few resources. He studied for a career as a laboratory dental technician, which is his profession today. Thanks to the quality of his work and to the good customer service that he offers he has a constant flow of customers to his office. Sandro will use this loan to buy a dentist chair which will allow him to continue improving his service.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dentist chair

loans.name: Louis

texts.fr: S. Louis est un jeune homme de 40 ans et vit à Lomé avec ses deux enfants au Togo. Il a une expérience riche en électronique et  désire se lancer dans les affaires pour monter une entreprise de Vidéo Club un coin de divertissement pour les chômeurs ce qui est pour lui une véritable aventure car difficile de rassembler les capitaux. Par ce premier crédit de FECECAV, il désire réaliser son rêve et tirer rapidement profit de cet investissement et faire des versements mensuels comme une sorte de remboursement de son emprunt.
texts.en:
Louis S. is a young man, 40 years of age, who lives in Lomé, Togo, with his two children. He has a wealth of experience in electronics and would like to get started in business establishing a Vidéo Club enterprise, a locale for the unemployed to entertain themselves. The enterprise is a real venture because of the difficulty of gathering capital. With this initial FECECAV loan, he would like to realize his dream of quickly deriving a profit from his investment. He would like to make monthly deposits as a way of repaying his loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a video club

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Bancomunal Mi Buen Pastor. 
Elena es conviviente, tiene 38 años, dos hijos de 7 y 12 años que están en la escuela particular.
Ella estudió cosmética dermatológica por tres años, tenia un salón de belleza, pero lo cerro por que conoció a su esposo desde hace nueve años, su esposo vende fruta, y ella se puso a trabajar con él en la venta de fruta todos los días de 9 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m.
En finca se siente tranquila, puede invertir  y mover más capital, aprende del negocio de las demás socias. 
Necesita un crédito de 1600 soles, para comprar de 30 cajones de fruta diaria. 
El sueño de Maria es terminar de estudiar dermatología y trabajar enseñando cosmetología.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the communal bank Mi Buen Pastor. She is married, 38 years old and has two children aged 7 and 12 that are in private school. She studied cosmetic dermatology for three years and had a beauty salon, but closed it because she met her husband. For nine years her husband has sold fruit and she went to work with him selling fruit every day from 9 am until 10 pm. On the farm she feels tranquil, she can invest and move more capital and learn the business from the other members. She needs a loan of 1600 soles to purchase 30 crates of fruit daily. The dream of Maria is to finish studying dermatology and work by teaching cosmetology.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy 30 crates of fruit

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine S., 32, is married with three children.  She has two years of experience in the retail business. She sells to the public five days a week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  Josephine expects her weekly net cash flow to be $166.  SPBD loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used only to buy more goods for her shop.

loans.use: To buy goods for the shop

loans.name: Eugenia Felicitas

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Bancomunal Amistad Unida.
Eugenia es casada tiene 55 años, dos hijos de 21 y 14 años, este último está en la escuela estatal.
Eugenia estudió corte y confección y trabajó en una fabrica por trece años, hasta que se casó y se independizo, ella confecciona en su casa ropa a medida y sale haber a sus clientas a otros distritos.  
Necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, ella va a incursionar en el negocio de la crianza de chanchos, va comprar 10 lechoncitos y comida para  chanchos.
Desde que está en Finca su economía ha mejorado antes no podía comprar telas para ofrecer a sus clienta, ahora compra telas al por mayor, hilos, aprendió a sobresalir en el negocio y ser independiente, también aprendió a tener amigas, era muy tímida. 
El sueño de Eugenia es ver a sus hijos  realizados como profesionales y dejarles un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Communal Bank Amistad Unida (“Unified Friendship”). Eugenia is married, 55 years old, and has two children ages 21 and 14, of which the latter is in state school. Eugenia studied cutting and tailoring and worked in a factory for thirteen years, until she married and became independent. She tailors clothing by measurement in her home and also leaves to see her clients in other districts. Eugenia needs a loan of 2,400 PEN; she will be venturing into the business of raising pigs, and will be purchasing 10 piglets and pig feed. Since she has been with Finca her economic situation has improved, before she was not able to purchase fabric to offer her clients, and now she is able to purchase wholesale fabric and threads. She learned to stand out in her business and to be independent; she also learned to make friends, as she was very timid. Eugenia’s dream is to see her children become professional and to leave them a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Eugenia needs a loan of 2,400 PEN; she will be venturing into the business of raising pigs, and will be purchasing 10 piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Otila

texts.en: Otila L., 31, is married with 4 children.  She has 4 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public 7 days a week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 166 Tala.  SPBD loans are Otila’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer, bushknives, filling, water hose, barbed wire, gromozones, pesticides, weedkiller and sprayer.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorn N. (shown in the picture with her son), 57, is a widow with seven children: five sons and two daughters. Three of her children are married and live outside the family home; one son is a security guard, and another son is a policeman. The family live along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Yorn has been growing rice for twenty-six years. She grows rice in her farmland near her village. She is asking for her first loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay fees for plowing.

loans.use: To use for growing rice

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly M. is from the town of Lallo, Cagayan. She is 21 years old, married, and has an infant. Jelly owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale.

Jelly joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jelly is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve fund for future emergencies. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
Naimjon is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three kids. From a young age, he demonstrated a talent for agriculture. Naimjon has always tried to be very responsible and very content with his farm work. When he finishes caring for his crops, he goes to help his father, because he wants to repay his father’s efforts. What his father likes best out of the whole agricultural process is the marketing, because he always hopes to get a good price for his crops. But once he gets to the market, he gets a little clumsy and sometimes loses track of the accounting. Naimjon always tries to help him out with some pointers. The loan Naimjon now is asking for is to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for his varied crops. The loan will greatly improve Naimjon’s income and his family's living standards.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Sofía Doris

texts.es:
La señora Sofía, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor Azangarina II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Azangaro, Provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 22 años de edad, es madre soltera, con 02 hijos y tiene estudios de segundaria incompleta (1er grado),  vive en el Barrio Ezequiel Urbiola.

Esta iniciando su negocio con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, con un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, este dinero lo utilizará para invertir en su negocio de venta de helados,  ella también trabaja dando servicio de llamadas telefónicas, y un día a la semana vende productos de la zona como chuño, papa, quinua, etc. Es decir, tiene varias actividades las cuales le permite solventar los gastos familiares.

Su mayor sueño es poner una tienda de abarrotes  para pder darles una buena educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gusta la facilidad de pagos que Manuela Ramos brinda a las mujeres de la zona.
texts.en:
Señora Sofía belongs to the Flor Azangarina II (Flower of Azángaro, 2nd) Communal Bank which is located in the Azángaro District and Province, Department of Puno. She is 22 years old and a single mother with two children. She has an incomplete secondary education and lives in the Ezequiel Urbiola neighborhood. She is starting her business with the Manuela Ramos movement, with a loan of 500 New Sols. This money will be used to invest in her business selling frozen treats. She also operates a telephone calling service, and one day of the week she sells locally grown products such as chuño (dried tubers), potatoes, quinoa, etc. That is to say, she has several activities with which to meet her family's household expenses. Her greatest dream is to open a grocery store in order to be able to give her children a good education. She likes the easy payments that Manuela Ramos offers to the women in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy locally grown products for sale.

loans.name: La Frontera Group

texts.es: El grupo “La Frontera” esta representado por la señora Adriana, es un grupo nuevo compuesto D. 19 personas, D. las cuales 3 ya participaron en aterieres grupos dentro D. la fundación Agrocapital, las mujeres se dedican a la venta D. comida, pan, cosméticos,  perfumes y los varones se dedican a actividades como el trasporte público, construcción y al servicio mecánico. Dentro D. los rubro comercial existe un alto nivel D. competencia pero las ganas D. salir adelante hacen que nuestras socios trabajen para sacar adelante a sus familias; es por esta razón que requieren D. un financiamiento, que les ayudara en la adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas para mejorar sus ingresos y por enD. a mejorar la calida D. vida D. sus familias. A pesar D. ser un grupo relativamente nuevo cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios debido a financiamientos en entidades similares a la fundación agrocapital quien le brinda un apoyo económico para sacar adelante a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank group "La Frontera" is represented by Sra. Adriana. This is a new group composed of 19 individuals, 3 of whom have previously participated with other groups within Fundación Agrocapital. The women sell food, bread, cosmetics and perfumes. The men are engaged in businesses such as public transportation, construction and mechanical repair services.

Within the local commercial area, there is a high level of competition that motivates our members to work hard to proviD. for their families. For this reason, they have requested a loan to help them acquire materials, supplies and tools to help them improve their earnings and thereby make life better for their families. Despite being a relatively new group, they are experienced with the solidarity loan concept. Financial entities, such as Fundación Agrocapital, are there to support them as they seek to improve the well-being of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro 6 Group

texts.en:
Vicente J. is approaching Esperanza for her fifth loan. She has been previously successful with investing and growing her business with her first four loans. She operates a business out of her home selling desserts and fresh fruit juice. She has used her previous loans to increase her selling volume, and, every time she has increased this volume, she has been able to sell all her products. This is a testament to her entrepreneurial skills and creative business strategies. 

Her ambition in the future is to have her own store to sell these products and to eventually have her own employees. It is a lofty goal considering her current state, but these are the goals that drive our borrowers to work hard every day. One of the reasons Vicente works hard at growing her business is to help her family. She is a single mother raising a nine-year-old girl and a five-year-old boy. She has the highest hopes for her children and wants them to continue their education and go on to college. She hopes to have them become business leaders like their mother, only on a much larger scale.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to increase selling volume of dessert pastries and fresh fruit juices

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Dupe sells fire-wood and is a cheap means of cooking for commercial and home use, Dupe also has machine for milling various items like maize, tomatoes e.t.c. she buys fire-wood from neighbouring villages and sells them in Lagos state. She has been in these businesses for many years and from this she assists her husband in running the home. Dupe is requesting for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase fire-wood in bulk at a reduced price, Dupe is 50 years old and married with  three children, her entire family is based in Lagos state. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase fire-wood to sell

loans.name: Hilola

texts.en:
K. Hilola is 28 years old. She and her husband have two children. Hilola bakes “lepeshka” at home, which is a flatbread and is considered to be the national bread of Tajikistan. Her husband (pictured) helps her with the business. Hilola sells the majority of her products from home. However, she has also hired a salesman who runs the trading place in the central local market for selling the "lepeshka”. Hilola is doing her best to give her children the best future she can. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 2000 Somoni. She is planning make wholesale purchases of the flour she needs for her business. Hilola is grateful to all who support her and promises to manage the loan meticulously.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy the flour wholesale that she needs for baking lapeshka.

loans.name: Khey

texts.en: Khey P., age 37, is married with five children. She lives with her husband in Battambong Province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling bread and dessert (jelly), typically earning US $5 per day. Her husband is currently employed in a private supermarket a security guard, earning an income of US $3.33 per day. Both of them have to work hard everyday to ensure a good living for their family and her five children. Consequently, she is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more bread and vegetable to resell. With the remainders, she wants to repair her house. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: buy bread and vegetable

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des engrais et payer du labour

loans.name: Afiafi

texts.en:
Afiafi T. is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Faleasiu Tualesolo. She is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Afiafi owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Afiafi has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Afiafi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Afiafi is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Afiafi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

Afiafi was not affected by tsunami which hit Samoa on 9/29/09.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Jantsandorj

texts.en:
Jantsandorj B. is a 45-year-old man who lives with his mother in the Uvurkhangai Province of Central Mongolia. He and his mother live together in a "ger," a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. 

B. operates a grocery and retail dairy business. He started his business in 2000 with 50,000 tugrugs of working capital. Since then, he has bought his own shipping container from which he operates his business and his working capital has grown to exceed 1,000,000 tugrugs. He would like to expand his business and be able to save money so that he can improve both his quality of life and his mother’s. 

B. is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (approx. $705 USD) loan to purchase a variety of dairy products for the upcoming winter months.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here

loans.use: To purchase a variety of dairy products for the upcoming winter months

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза Юлдашева проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 25 лет. Замужем, имеет 1 ребенка. Муж находится в России на заработках. Сама Фируза более 10 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Она выращивает пшеницу, картошку, и лук. Кредит просит для закупа удобрений, и семян, чтобы посеить новый урожай.
texts.en:
Firuza Y. lives in the Shakhrituz region. She is 25 years old. She is married, with one child. Her husband is working in Russia. Firuza herself has been farming for 10 years. She grows wheat, potatoes, and onions. She is asking for the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds to plant a new crop.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Planting a new crop

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun T., age 31, owns a grocery store in front of her home, where she sells various kinds of cooking ingredients to earn a living. Bun T. has been in this business since the beginning of 2000 and is earning around US$ 5 each day. She is married to Seng Hun, 36, who is an electrician for a ministry.

Bun T. has conducted her business very well and gained many customers and income. Recently, part of her inventory has sold out and she lacks money to resupply her stock. Therefore, Bun T. requests a loan of US$ 400 which she will use to buy additional grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Mary Dave

texts.en: Mary Dave C. is from the village of Danao. She is 21 years old and is married. Mary Dave owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Mary Dave joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Mary Dave is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica Q. is from the village of Libag Sur, Tuguegarao City. She is 49 years old. Monica is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Monica owns & operates a business planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Monica has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Monica joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Monica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. Monica is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Monica from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Ali

texts.ru: Коров Али проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат. имеет 5 детей. Коров Али имеет высшее образование по специальности "Педагог". Животноводством занимается более 7 лет. Коров Али откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Ali K. lives in the Jilikul district. He is 36 years old, married and has 5 children. Ali has a higher education as a teacher. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 7 years. Ali raises cattle and sells livestock. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina L. is a widow who supports her family through her general store. She lives in Pescadora St., San Enrique, Negros Occidental with her three children ages from 33 to 39 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,000.

Josefina is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can maintain operations of her general store. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Josefina aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en: Asuncion C. is from the village of Manolo, Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old, is widowed, and has two school-aged children. Asuncion owns and operates a a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Asuncion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Asuncion plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
el joven Miguel Antonio M. F. tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres en la colonia suiza de la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
 
el se dedica a la venta de pescado en zona de San Lorenzo y Nacaome, se transporta en una moto, coloca el pescado en una hielera y lo vende de casa en casa en los barrios y colonias que visita. muchas personas lo prefieren por el tamaño y lo fresco que vende el pescado, ademas a sus clientes se les hace mas facil ya que el lleva los pescados a la puerta de la casa y sus clientes no se tienen que desplazar para comprar dicho producto.
 
esta solicitando el credito para la compra de pescado blanco y rojo. En la epoca de semana santa es cuando el pescado se vende mejor.
texts.en:
Young Miguel Antonio M. F. is 23 years old, is single and lives with his parents in the Swiss neighborhood of the city of San Lorenzo. He sells fish in the area of San Lorenzo and Nacaome. He travels by motorcycle, carrying the fish in a cooler, and he sells it house to house in the neighborhoods he visits. Many people prefer his fish because of its size and freshness. He also makes it easier for his customers by bringing the fish to the door of the house so they don't have to go out to buy it. He is asking for this loan to buy white and red fish. Around the time of Holy Week is when fish sells best.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married and has two daughters. She is an entrepreneur from Gladkovka, Kherson region. Nataliya grows and sells farmed produce, e.g. cabbage, radishes and potatoes. Her son is actively helping her with transportation of merchandise as he owns a nice truck. Nataliya started this business 6 years ago. Currently, she receives about 30,000 – 35,000 Grivnyas of income a month. 

Nataliya is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase new polyethylene film to replace ruined film in her greenhouses, as well as to buy fertilizers and seeds for this spring farming season. She is confident that availability of lending services will help her repair her greenhouses and start farming season in time thus facilitating further expansion of her agricultural venture. Nataliya’s goal is to continue refining her business skills so that she can keep her venture growing and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, polyethylene film, fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: School fees

loans.name: Lenoi Ene

texts.en:
Lenoi Ene I. is 51 years-old. She is married to Riyian I. and is the mother of four children.  Lenoi is a wheat farmer in an area which normally does well due to good climatic conditions. She has been farming for the last four years.

Lenoi learned about Kiva partner KADET from other women who had already registered as members in KADET. This will be her fourth loan and she plans to use it to prepare the land to plant more wheat. She hopes to use the profits from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activities from small scale to commercial farming.

Lenoi dreams of doing large scale farming in order to attain financial independence. She is a hard working woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To prepare the land.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés,de 40 años, vive con su esposo Nicanor (51) , juntos viven con sus 6 hijos ,en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 5 años se dedica a  la venta de verduras en un mercado muy populoso, que esta alejado de su vivienda , es por esta razón que le es dificultoso viajar durante dos horas diarias para llegar hasta su puesto de venta. Pero al margen de esta dificultad , se siente muy contenta, pues su trabajo la mantiene ocupada durante todo el día, y logra buenas ventas gracias a las constantes compras de sus habituales clientes ,que ha obtenido , gracias a su carisma y espontaneidad, pues siempre esta con una sonrisa en el rostro en el momento de la atención. Inés  siente que si sigue trabajando con mucho empeño , como hasta ahora, logrará buenos resultados . Para más adelante tiene planeado incrementar su capital para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.Es el tercer crédito que tiene con  MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser responsable  y promete ser puntual  en el pago de todas sus cuotas.Tiene pensado invertir el  dinero solicitado en  la compra de mayor cantidad de vegetales, pues durante estos meses tienen bastante demanda , y  así quiere aumentar sus ganancias .
texts.en:
Inés, who is 40-years-old, lives with her husband Nicanor (51-years-old). They live together with their six children in their own home. For five years she has been selling vegetables in a very busy market that is quite far from her home. It is difficult for her to travel two hours each day to be able to get to the market to sell her produce. Aside from the difficult commute, she is quite happy because her work keeps her busy all day, and manages good sales thanks to the ongoing purchases of the repeat-clientele she has earned thanks to her charisma and spontaneity. She always has a smile on her face when she’s taking care of them.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria N. is from the village of Bitag Pequeño, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 32 years old. Victoria is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Victoria owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP whenever she sells her raised pigs.

In 2009, Victoria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Victoria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma D. is a 59-year-old married woman who supports her family with her general store. She lives in Brgy. Cambarus Pontevedra, Negros Occidental with her 67-year-old husband, Romulo, who is a retired employee and their five adult children. Thelma has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and by her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Thelma is now borrowing 20,000 PHP so that she can buy additional products to sell in her general store. This will be her tenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step on her journey towards economic freedom. Thelma hopes to improve her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy makeup, cremes, perfumes, shampoo, makeup bags etc.

loans.name: My's Group

texts.en: Mrs. My M. is a group leader who is 1961, selected by four members whom all are made up a group loan in Trapeang Tnaot village, Takeo province. Each member will use portion of their loan for varied goal in which it can improve their living with this loan. Mrs. My M. is a farmer who owns one-hectare plot of land where she can grow crop to sell to support her family. Her problem is that her field infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. My M. is seeking for a loan to buy fertilizer and rest of the loan she hires farming laborers. She is widow with a child who is studying at school and helps her to do farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Try For Me Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Try For Me” group from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Marie K. is the leader of this group. The thirty-five-year-old is married to a miner and they have four children. Marie has been a businesswoman for many years now, she sells rice, palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), groundnuts/peanuts, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy rice, palm oil, groundnuts, etc.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: El señor Adolfo tiene  30 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo de cuatro años de edad. El señor se dedica a una pulpería, el posee en su casa de habitación una pulpería llamada San Danielo, tiene 10 años de tenerla la cual en principio le pertenecía a su mama. Don Adolfo ha continuado con este negocio debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para mantener a su familia, además que es un negocio bastante rentable. El señor solicita este crédito con el propósito de comprar más mercadería, ya que desea generar mayores ingresos. Su sueño es ampliar mas su negocio para generar mayores ganancias y de esta manera, mejorar la casa en que habita.
texts.en:
Adolfo, 30, is married and has a four-year-old son. He has had a grocery store, called San Danielo, in his homefor 10 years; it used to belong to his mother. Adolfo has continued with this business because he needs to generate income to support his family; besides it’s quite a profitable business. He is asking for funding to buy more merchandise because he wants to produce higher income. His dream is to expand his store further to generate still higher profits and be able to make some improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos tiene 49 años, vive en casa de su suegra, en compañía de sus 2 hijos. Desde sus 15 años se dedica a la venta de medias y lencerías en general y como no le eran muy rentables quiso diversificar su actividad, es entonces que le saco provecho a su lavadora y comenzó lavar ropa ajena, aunque en un inicio le fue difícil por no tener mucha clientela, con el tiempo pudo establecer su negocio. Desde entonces y durante el día trabaja lavando ropa; casi no sale de su casa para no perder clientela. Esta muy contenta con su trabajo, ya que las realiza dentro de su casa. Han transcurrido 5 años en esta labor, y tiene proyectos futuros, como el tener un local propio, asimismo desea dedicar a la venta de chicharrones. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas como lo venia haciendo, porque valora este aporte que le es muy beneficioso para su progreso. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar detergentes, lejías y jabones, por otro lado también desea comprar ollas y utensilios para iniciar su añorado negocio de comida.
texts.en:
Santos, 49, lives in her mother-in-law’s house with her two children. At the age of 15 she started selling hosiery and lingerie. As they became less profitable she wanted to diversify her activity so she decided to take advantage of her washing machine and started to take in laundry. Although it was difficult at first because she didn’t have many customers, in time she was able to establish her business. Since then she works all day washing clothes; she hardly ever leaves the house in order not to lose potential customers. She is very happy with her work because she does it at home. She has been at this for 5 years and she has future projects, like owning her own place. She also wants to sell chicharrones (fried pork rinds). This is her 9th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay punctually like she’s always done in the past because she values this contribution that is so beneficial to her progress. She will use the requested funds to buy detergents, lye and soaps. She also wants to buy pots and utensils for the food business she so dearly wants.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy detergents, soap and other laundry supplies.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
El Sr. Luciano es de la ciudad de Roque González, actualmente por motivos de trabajos está viviendo en la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad.
Hace varios años que trabaja como albañil, comenta que es un oficio que adquirió de su familia, ya que su padre y sus hermanos también tienen ese trabajo, luego poco a poco Luciano fue independizándose y hoy en día trabaja por cuenta propia y gracias a su esfuerzo, él es un profesional independiente.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas que el mismo usa en su trabajo como: mezcladora,valdes, cucharas para albañilerias y otros.
Agradece a  Fundación Paraguaya por brindarle la oportunidad de adquirir un préstamo y así ir completando sus herramientas de trabajo.
texts.en:
Sr. Luciano is from the town of Roque González, but he currently lives in Carapeguá because of work. He has a 3-year old son. He has worked as a bricklayer for several years, a job that his father and brothers also have. Gradually Luciano became more independent and nowadays, through hard work, he has his own business. He is seeking a loan to buy tools to use in his work such as a cement mixer, buckets, special bricklayers’ trowels etc. Luciano is grateful to Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya for providing him with this opportunity to obtain a loan so he can obtain all the tools he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane A, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bricklayers' tools

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita B. is from the village of Cabisera 27. She is 40 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Perlita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Perlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As with her previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI which she has successfully repaid, this new loan of 6,000 PHP will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This will be the fourth loan that Perlita has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa S. is from the village of Malibud, Gingoog City. She is 50 years old. Theresa is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Theresa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and junk foods in the local community. She is also engaged in buying and selling of rice per kilogram. Theresa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Theresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Theresa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Theresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Myline

texts.en:
Myline M., age 26, is a local butcher in the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. Myline has been butchering and selling fresh pork in her community for over a year and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have three school-aged children. 
  
Earlier this year, Myline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Myline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional pigs. She is requesting a second loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional pigs for the business and used as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs for the business to use as working capital

loans.name: Delchie

texts.en:
Mrs. Delchie F. is from the villlage of Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, married to Ludivindo F. and blessed with 2 children of whom one is now school-aged and the other is still an infant. To make a living, she is presently engaged in gasoline retailing business.. They’re earning an average amount of not less than Php 3,000 from this kind of business. 

Just this year, Delchie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  As a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, Delchie has successfully repaid a loan amount of P 5,000. She is now requesting a loan of Php 15,000 as her 2nd loan which will be used as additional capital for her gasoline retailing business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, making loan repayments, paying for children’s education and possible business expansion.

 About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her gasoline retailing business

loans.name: Po's Group

texts.en:
This group loan, which consists of four members, is located in Anlong Ta Sek Leu village in Kandal province. The members plan to use the loans they obtain for different purposes.

Mr. Po D. is the group leader who has been selected by the other members. He and his wife, Mrs. Savey Choem, are farmers who own a five-hectare plot of land where they grow rice and taro to sell to support their family living. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to grow taro in the field. So, to improve production, Mr. Po D. is asking for a loan to buy taro root for this purpose. 

He is 51 years old and he is a father of five children, three of whom are farmers while the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy taro root.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase materials for his shop

loans.name: Fredy Antonio

texts.es:
Fredy Antonio A. C. tiene 31 años, es soltero y vive con sus padres. El tiene un hijo que nació recién (menos que un mes). El vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Fredy es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.   

Fredy se dedica a la siembra de maíz y yuca y el tiene este negocio desde hace 2 anos. El compra y vende sus productos en Matilde Esther. El solicita el crédito para ampliar las siembras y tener mejor producción. Gracias al crédito el podrá superar la producción. 

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su propio negocio de compra y venta de productos y también tener su propia casa ya que en este momento vive en una casa arrendada. El desafío que enfrenta en el negocio es la baja producción en época de invierno.
texts.en:
Fredy Antonio A. C. is 31 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents.  He has a newborn son who is less than one month old.  He lives in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

Fredy is a member of the 'Unidos Somos Más' (United We Are Stronger) rural loan group.  This new group is located in the community of Matilde Esther, in Guayas province, 2 hours from our Chillanes office in Bolívar province.  The group has 23 members who work in different business activities such as farming, livestock raising and running small restaurants and eateries.

Fredy grows corn and cassava.  He has been in this business for 2 years.  He buys and sells his products in Matilde Esther.  He is requesting this loan to expand the crops he grows and to grow them better.  This loan will help him to improve his production.  His dream for the future is to own his own business buying and selling products.  He would also like to have his own home as he is currently living in a rented house.  The challenge that he faces in his business is low production during the winter season.

loans.use: To expand the crops he grows and to grow them better

loans.name: Marion

texts.en: Marion is a thirty-year-old married woman with one child living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda with a family dream of building her own residential home. She has been in the motorcycle business for two years and the business seems to be worth the venture after she changed over from a retail shop. Her aspiration is to own at least three motorcycles. Marion needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle for transport business

loans.name: Amalia's Group

texts.en:
Amalia R. is from the village of Magdalena, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 32 years old. Amalia is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Amalia is married and has 2 school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Amalia has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Amalia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amalia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Amalia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La señora Sonia se dedica al comercio de frutas, tiene su puesto de venta en la ciudad de Quillacollo, la señora se dedica a dicha actividad desde hace cinco años dicha actividad y el puesto de venta lo heredo de su madre y su madre de su abuela, por esta razón solicita el crédito para capital de trabajo y mejorar su puesto de venta, es madre soltera ya que su esposo la abandono y ella sola mantiene su hogar, es joven y muy trabajadora sale adelante sola y ella desea mejorar su calidad de vida, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sonia has a stand where she sells fruit in the city of Quillacollo.  She has been working in this business activity for five years.  She inherited the business activity and the stand from her mother.  Her mother inherited it from her grandmother.

That is the reason she is requesting a loan for work capital and to improve her stand.  She is a single mother because her husband abandoned her.  She supports her household by herself.  She is young and very hard-working.  She gets ahead by herself.  She wishes to improve her quality of life.  She is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: Work capital and to improve her stand

loans.name: Oliver

texts.es: Oliver, de 26 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador. Vive junto a su papá Carlos y su mamá Catalina en la comunidad de guacamayo (selva central peruana). Hace 10 años que se dedica a la siembra de cítricos como: naranja, tangelo, asimismo siembra cacao, los cuales vende en el mercado de frutas de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son los días donde quita la maleza de sus cultivos, pues gusta de verlos limpios. Ahora en la campaña de café que se avecina, comenzará a trabajar como peón en diferentes cultivos de café. Él pertenece al banco comunal “nuevo amanecer de guacamayo”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se compromete a ser responsable y cumplido con su banco comunal. Oliver, invertirá el crédito en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico los cuales esparcirá entre sus cultivos de cítricos que cosechará el próximo mes.
texts.en:
Oliver, age 26, is a single hardworking gentleman. He lives with his father Carlos and mother Catalina in the community of Guacamayo in the central Peruvian jungle. For the past ten years he has cultivated citrus crops such as oranges and tangelos. In addition, he grows cacao. Oliver sells his fruits at the market in Pichanaki. What he enjoys most about his work are the days he sets aside for pulling weeds because he likes seeing clean fields. Now that the coffee season is approaching, he will begin work as a laborer for different coffee farms.

Oliver is a member of the Communal Bank “Nuever Amanecer de Guacamayo” (New Dawn of Guacamayo). This is his first loan with MFP. He promises to be responsible and committed in his Communal Bank. Oliver will invest this loan in the purchase of several sacks of organic fertilizers to apply on his citrus crops that will be harvested next month.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en: Hussain is a 25 year-old married man, living in Chtaoura with his wife and child. Hussain works in furniture-making.  He opened his own working place in 2010.  Hussain faced a problem at the beginning because his place isn't next to the main road.  That made it hard to find him. Now his clients know how to contact him, and it's easier than before. Hussain is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy new, updated machines necessary for his business.  These machines can help to finish the requested work in less time. This is the first time Hussain has requested a loan, and he hopes to  expand his business more in the future.  He might change his working area to a better known place, although now most of his clients know where to find him and when they recommend him to others, they lead them to his place easily.

loans.use: to buy new updated machines

loans.name: Vegelyn

texts.en: Vegelyn is 40 years old, married and has three children. Her oldest child is 15 and her youngest is 11. She and her husband make a living by growing rice and corn. She also runs a sari-sari (or variety) store on the side, where she sells items such canned goods, noodles and coffee. She plans to use this loan to buy corn and rice seeds as well as fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: to buy corn and rice seeds as well as fertilizer.

loans.name: Dulce Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “Dulce Esperanza” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes  ,  como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas, modista etc.
Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. 
La Señora Maria C. es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a la venta de mercaderías comestibles  para poder mantener a sus sobrinos, que quedaron sin mamá (huérfanos) siendo muy pequeños.
Es una señora muy trabajadora y joven. Ella no tiene hijos y su marido es electricista. Además se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo.
La señora Maria solicita el crédito para la compra de mas variedad y cantidad de viveres.
texts.en:
The “Dulce Esperanza” (Sweet Hope) committee was formed when several neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso joined together.  All the committee members carry out independent activities like: sales, fast food preparation, dressmaking, etc.  The members formed a very united group that’s able to carry out activities together that strengthen their companionship.

Mrs. María Centurión is one of the members.  She sells foodstuffs to support her nieces and nephews who were left motherless (orphans) at a very young age.  

She is a very hard working young woman.  She does not have any children of her own and her husband’s an Electrician.  She is very satisfied with her activity and with the training the group gets.  

María is asking for the loan to buy a greater variety and amount of groceries.

loans.use: to buy more groceries.

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.en: Juvenal is 54 years old. He has 5 children; one is already married while another is 10 years old. Juvenal sells food items such as beans and sorghum. His wife is a farmer. He has been selling food stuffs for the past 20 years and this business has enabled him meet the needs of his family. He is requesting a loan to buy more food items to sell.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs such as beans, sorghum, etc.

loans.name: Muso

texts.en:
Muso is married and has 4 children. He lives in Kumsangir, Tajikistan, and sells groceries from his food store. His vending location is well known for good prices that are lower than market prices. Muso knows his customers’ preferences and always offers them only good quality groceries. He has been in the grocery trade for about 4 years. His business has been marked with consistent stability.

Muso is hoping to invest a loan of $1000 USD in additional merchandise, which will help him increase his turnover capital eventually. Muso has a vision for the expansion of his trade, and we believe it will be helpful in his entrepreneurial endeavors. The loan will help Muso to persist, take small steps at a time, and achieve success.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuff for his grocery store

loans.name: Belancille

texts.en:
Belancille is 41 years old. She has 7 children who are between the ages of 6-21 years old. Six of the children are in school. 

Belancilla owns a general store in which she sells a variety of items such as salt, matches, sandals, juices, biscuits, etc. She has done this business for 4 years and she works with her husband. This business supports the well-being of Belancille’s family. She needs a loan to buy more items for her shop such as soap, candles, cooking oil, etc. to make more profits. She plans to buy a goat from the profits that she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy candles, soap, cooking oil and other items to stock in her store.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina and her multi-service business have had a great impact on many new immigrants in her community. Many clients from Central America use her store’s services--money transfers, calling cards, tickets and cargo--to help them connect with their families back home. 

Josefina received a loan from ACCION USA in the past, but unfortunately, like many small business owners she was greatly affected by the sluggish economy. She works full-time at her business and has a second part-time job in the evenings, delivering pizzas in order to cover her personal expenses and keep her business running.

Josefina’s second loan from ACCION USA will help her purchase a professional scale to improve the cargo services she offers. She would also like to implement an aggressive marketing campaign to gain more customers.

loans.use: to purchase a professional scale and implement an aggressive marketing campaign.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda de 51 años de edad, casada con manolo de 52 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos, por quienes debe de sacrificarse. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Ella se dedica al negocio agrícola, en donde produce y comercializa café a un precio competitivo, incluso ya tiene mucha presencia en su localidad, y los resultados en cuanto a ventas son positivas, con respecto a los años anteriores. Esto es debido a la  buena atención hacia sus clientes. Por lo general trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, pero en temporada de cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones,  para que lo faciliten en la extracción de su producto final. Normalmente su producto de café los vende en los centros de acopio de su misma comunidad, y su rutina laboral es de lunes a sábado, a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. Su plan a futuro es construir su casa a base de material noble, con la finalidad de que le pueda brindar seguridad y felicidad a su familia. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella  se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con su negocio. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles podrá contratar peones para que se encarguen de limpiar y cuidar su parcela.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 51 years old and married to Manolo, age 52. They have 4 children that they make sacrifices for. Together, they live in their own house in the Pichari district. She has an agricultural business where she produces and sells coffee at a competitive price. Compared to prior years, she has developed a strong reputation in her area and because of her good customer service she is seeing strong sales. In general she works alongside her husband, but during the harvest season, she takes charge of hiring laborers to facilitate the harvest of their final products. Typically they sell their coffee in common areas in their own community from Monday to Saturday between 7am and 6pm.  

In the future, she plans to build a house made of strong materials so that she can provide security and happiness to her family. This is the second loan with MFP, and she promises to repay punctually. For this reason, she is hopes for each of your support to continue repaying her loan. With the 2,000 nuevos soles she will be able to hire the laborers she needs to clean and care for her crops.

loans.use: Hire laborers to help her care for her land

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last ten years.  She is 39 years old, married to Peter, and they have four school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her fifth loan.  She paid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer for planting.  

In future, Teresia hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
