loans.use: To purchase more sugar, beans, salt, cooking oil rice, and wheat flour in bulk

loans.name: Bummi

texts.en: Bummi sells crates of drinks. She hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She is 42 years old and married to O. who is a printer and they have three children. She says thank you and promises to pay back promptly

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Byambahuu

texts.en:
Byambahuu T. lives with her husband and 20 year old daughter in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter is a sophomore student at the Mongolian University of Science and Technology in Ulaanbaatar.

Byambahuu has a small retail business selling women's handbags and purses. She sells from a small, rented stall in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. She brings her goods from Ereen, a border town in China from which many products are imported. Sometimes she travels to Beijing to purchase higher quality handbags and purses. In the future, she would like to rent stalls at busy shopping malls in the city. She requests a loan to purchase more handbags and purses from Ereen.

loans.use: To purchase more handbags and purses to sell.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Huệ Nguyễn Thị (832011168) is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has 2 adult children. To earn a living, Huệ owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Huệ has been engaged in this business for over 9 years and earns approximately 4,800,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2001, Huệ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Huệ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Huệ is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 9th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Huệ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business.

loans.use: used to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Carolina

texts.es:
La señora María Carolina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 40 años y 06 hijos, 03 de ellos que están bajo su responsabilidad. 

María, se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir trabajando, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas y venta de comida. Manifiesta que con el negocio que ejerce se siente muy tranquila y contenta y es quien administra su negocio. 

Su negocio se ubica en los interiores de una empresa de venta de pollos, llamada “Don Pollo” en un ambiente especialmente acondicionado, por lo que su venta diaria de comida lo tiene asegurada,  ya que brinda pensión a los mismos trabajadores de la empresa. Esta muy contenta, se siente muy capaz y responsable con las cuotas que debe pagar mensualmente al Banco Comunal.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos, para la preparación de sus comidas como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, huevos y pollos en javas y paquetes de aceites, lo necesario para la preparación de sus comidas. Parte del dinero, que lo invertirá comprando bebidas como: gaseosas de diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas. Así como agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
María Carolina, se siente orgullosa por haber logrado implementar su negocio, y asegurarse una vejez tranquila. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a superarse y a otras mujeres que quieren salir adelante y a defenderse como mujeres.
texts.en:
María Carolina belongs to the communal bank “La Marginal II”, which is located in the district of Tarapoto, in the province of San Martin, and in the department of San Martín. She lives with her husband and she is 40 years old. She has 6 children and three of them still live at home with her and depend on her. María has a lot of strength to continue working hard. She makes a living by selling soft drinks and food items. She is very happy with her business and she loves that she is the one in charge of the business. Her business is located inside of a company that sells chicken and is called “Don Pollo”. The space that she sells out of was especially set up for her business and her daily sales of food are guaranteed since she sells food to the workers of the company. She is very happy and she feels very capable and responsible for the payments that she must make to the communal bank each month. With the $350 that she is requesting she want to invest the money in buying the necessary ingredients for the preparation of her food items. She plans on buying large quantities of rice, sugar, eggs, chicken and cooking oil. Part of the money will also be invested in the purchase of different types and sizes of soft drinks. She will also buy carbonated and non-carbonated mineral water to sell. María Carolina feels proud that she was able to start a business. She now feels more secure about being financial independent in her old age. She is thankful for the Manuela Ramos Movement because it has helped her to improve her life and it has helped other women like her to get ahead in life and to take care of themselves and their families.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare her foods and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Hoàng

texts.en:
A. Nguyễn Thị HoÀng A. (401040006) is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, A. owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling liquor, such as beer and wine, in the local community. A. has been engaged in this business for over 9 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, A. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. A. successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. A. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. A. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nestor William

texts.es: Néstor William R. A. tiene 30 años. Es un hombre casado tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la fabricación de tejas. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica este negocio. El negocio estaba a cargo de su Papa, por lo que Néstor decide invertir en este negocio por lo que tenía muy buenos clientes. Esto motiva lo suficiente a Néstor porque además tenía que proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de sus productos. Su deseo es comprar un local mucho más amplio para producir mucho mas.
texts.en:
William Nestor R. A. is 30 years old, married and has one dependent child. His business is the manufacture of tiles. He has been in this business for over 20 years. His father started the business, so Nestor decided to invest in this business since it had very good customers and because he had to provide for his family.

The reason he is asking for a loan is to invest in the purchase of materials for the production of tile. His desire is to buy a much wider office and increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en: T. Farrukh is a 29-year-old man. His wife works as a housekeeper, and they have four children. His family plans include moving forward with crop production so that he can financially support his children’s studies. Farrukh has been working in agriculture for five years. The biggest problem he faces is that pest insects have affected his crops, and he does not have enough money to deal with the problem. He is requesting this loan in order to use it for his crops, thus thwarting losses. Agriculture is his family’s source of income. For this reason, Farrukh gives thanks to IMON and Kiva for the support they are giving him with this loan, which will be of great benefit to his crops. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase insecticide as well as seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa N. est une femme de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle fait de l’embauche bovine et aimerait développer son activité. Son objectif est de contribuer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Awa N. is a 42 year old woman who is married and is the mother of 2 children. She fattens cattle and would like to develop her business. Her goal is to contribute to the support of her family.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fatten cattle

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia D. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis, Occidental. She is 52-years-old. Cornelia is married and has one school-age child. Cornelia owns and operates a "tuba" retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products in the local community. Cornelia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cornelia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cornelia is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cornelia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Cette dame vend dans le marché de Bè à Lomé des mèches, des sacs pour dame et des habits de petites filles. Grâce à ce commerce, elle arrive à subvenir à ses besoins de base ; elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2004. Elle n’est pas mariée et n’a pas non plus aucun enfant à sa charge. Elle a loué dans le marché un petit espace qui lui permet de vendre ses articles. Elle est connue de nombreuses personnes car accueillant bien sa clientèle. Actuellement elle est presque en rupture de stock pour les tissages et les habits d’enfants. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 250 mèches Outré, 80 tissages et 200 pièces d’habits pour petites filles. Elle pense que ce prêt apportera un grand changement dans son commerce.
texts.en:
In the market of Bè à Lomé, this woman sells hair extensions, bags for women and clothes for little girls. Thanks to this business, she is able to provide for her basic needs. She started this business in 2004. She is not married and does not have any children in her care. She rents a small space in the market, where she can sell her wares. She is well-known by numerous people for welcoming her clientele. Currently, she is almost out of her stock of hair extensions and children's clothes. In order to re-stock, she is requesting a loan from the micro-finance organization WAGES in order to purchase 250 Outré brand hair extensions, 80 sets of weaves and 200 sets of clothes for little girls. She thinks that this loan will give her the opportunity to make big changes in her business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions, weaves and clothes for little girls

loans.name: Marta Esmeralda

texts.es: Marta Esmeralda R. De López reside en Santo Tomas en el departamento de San Salvador, Marta tiene 30 años de edad vive en casa de sus suegros con su esposo y sus dos hijos Gerardo de 14 años y Ronald 11 años de edad. Marta instalo su negocio hace seis años, el cual es administrado y atendido por ella, “Pupuseria Martita” nombre que lleva su negocio, tiene una clientela muy estable, la cual ha ayudado a Marta a generar ingresos con lo que ayuda a su esposo para los gastos de la familia, ella ahora solicita de este crédito con la finalidad de compara mayor cantidad de insumos para aumentar la producción de pupusas.
texts.en:
Marta Esmeralda R. De López lives in Santo Tomas in the department of San Salvador. She is 30 years old, married, and has 2 children – Gerardo (age 14) and Ronald (age 11). Marta and her family live in the house of her in-laws. Six years ago she started a business she manages herself called “Pupuseria Martita”, which is named after her. Marta has a stable clientele, which has helped her generate income and enabled her to help her husband with family expenses.

She is now requesting a loan so that she can buy supplies in large quantities and increase her production of pupusas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her business

loans.name: Vitaliano

texts.en:
Vitaliano is 43 years old and has been married for 20 years. He and his wife have six children, ages 19, 17, 15, 13, 10, and 8. Vitaliano's father died when he was young, so he began helping his mother on their farm. As a result, he never finished primary school and hardly knows how to read or write. Like many dairy cow farmers in the area, he learned farming by helping his parents when he was a child. Vitaliano is a dairy cow farmer who produces and sells milk but, at the moment, they have only three dairy cows. Vitaliano and his family live in a small and humble home in Quillacollo, a large suburb of the city of Cochabamba. 

With this loan from CIDRE, Vitaliano will purchase another dairy cow to augment his milk production. He hopes to increase his earnings and improve his family's quality of life. Vitaliano would like to construct a new home for his family and hopes that his five younger children will be able to study to become professionals. His oldest daughter could not continue her studies because Vitaliano and his wife lacked the financing necessary to pay for her education at the time, so she only studied through primary school and is currently working in Argentina.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
“Success is at the end of every sacrifice”; that's the encouraging motto Antonio D. of Brgy. San Nicolas, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya follows. He is now 55 years old and still single. He chose to remain single because he wants to take care of his parents who are now old and weak.

He owns and manages a small beauty parlor offering haircuts, pedicures and manicures to his friends, neighbors, and people in the community who need his service. Through his patience and sacrifices, he is able to earn a net income of Php 3,000.00 a month which goes to satisfying their basic needs and allows him to save some for their future. He wants to continue and improve this business but he doesn't have enough capital. Therefore, he wants to borrow the amount of Php 6,000.00 to increase his capital to improve his small business. He hopes that with patience and sacrifice, he can improve his business and increase his income.

loans.use: Additional capital for improving his beauty salon

loans.name: Ma. Helen's Group

texts.en:
Ma. Helen W. is from the village of Union, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 34 years old. Ma. Helen is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ma. Helen is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Helen owns & operates a direct-selling business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing personal-use products in the local community. Ma. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Ma. Helen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Helen is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase some hogs to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ma. Helen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase some hogs to raise

loans.name: Betzabeth

texts.es:
Betzabeth es una mujer de 35 años, muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada y lo que más desea es tener una buena vida.
Su negocio es la venta de películas, música, video clips, documentales, dibujos animados, etc. en formatos de DVD, esta actividad le es muy rentable, ya que tiene su puesto de venta en Santa Lucia (Distrito de la ciudad de Juliaca), donde la demanda por sus artículos es grande y le genera buenos ingresos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene la posibilidad de ver las películas que desea mientras está vendiendo, lleva 6 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trasladar su mercadería desde la ciudad de Juliaca, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador. 
Con el tiempo, anhela que su negocio crezca y le pueda generar mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Betzabeth con MFP y está muy feliz de la oportunidad,  sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que siempre tiene un consejo para sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más DVDs, con los cuales pueda incrementar su stock y ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Betzabeth is a cheerful and hard-working 35-year-old woman. She lives in a rented house and what she most wants is to live a good life. Her business sells movies, music, video clips, documentaries, cartoons, etc, in DVD format. This is a very profitable activity since she has a kiosk in Santa Lucia (a district of the city of Juliaca), where the demand for these items is high and generates a large income. What she likes most about her job is the opportunity to watch whatever movies she wants while she works. She has six years' experience in the business and finds that the most difficult part is transporting her merchandise from the city of Juliaca, since the road is very long and exhausting. She hopes that her business will grow over time and thereby increase her profits. This is Betzabeth's first loan with MFP and she is very happy to have the opportunity. She knows that she must make payments on time and is prepared to do so. She is well-liked among her peers at the communal bank since she always has good advice for them. With the thousand nuevos soles requested she will buy more DVDs, which will augment her inventory and enable her to offer better variety to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita B. is from the village of Libag Sur, Tuguegarao City. She is 51 years old and is married. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making tamarind candy for sale in the community.

Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en:
Melecio D. is from the village of Luinab, Iliga City. He is 51 years old. Melecio is married and has ten school-aged children. To make a living, Melecio owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Melecio has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Melecio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation by engaging in business activities. Melecio is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand his product offering

location.town: Luinab, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda G. is from the village of Banquero. She is 40 years old. Yolanda is married and has 2 school-age children. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Yolanda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Davlatmand

texts.ru: Нодиров Давлатманд проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 26 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Жена, домохозяйка. Родители живут вместе с ними. Давлатманд зарабатывает путем разведения крупно- рогатого скота. Имеет не большой коровник. Покупает молодых бычков, откармливает и продает на рынке. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 10 лет. Это помогает обеспечивать его семью. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Davlatmand N. lives in the Yavan district. He is 26 years old, married and has one child. His wife is a homemaker. The parents live together with them. Davlatmand earns a living by breeding cattle and has a small cow barn. He buys young bulls, feeds them up and sells them at the market. He has been involved in this type of business for 10 years. This business helps him provide for his family. Davlatmand is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
Josè Francisco T. A.  tiene 44 años, es casado, y  tiene cinco hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Josè trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, trigo papas, mora, habas y también a la cría de chanchos y  borregos.

Vende los productos en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda cada seis meses.
La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Josè le  gusta caminar.
 
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Josè Francisco T. A. is 44 years old, is married and has 5 children. He lives in the Guaranda subdivision in the Bolivar province. Josè is a member of the solidarity group "Grupo Enmanuel" which is located 45 minutes from the Guaranda subdivision, capital of the Bolivar province. The solidarity group has a total of 17 members and the community revolves around agriculture and livestock. The members are indigenous and all speak Quechua. Josè works in farming to increase his family's income. The crops that do best are corn, wheat, potatoes, blackberries and lima beans. He also raises pigs and sheep. Josè sells his products at the wholesale market in Guaranda every six months. The principal culture is the carnival that is celebrated in February. Josè enjoys walking. Josè is requesting this loan to purchase supplies for his work especially fertilizers and manures. His goal is to have a good economic activity for his family. The challenges that he faces are problems with the weather and the diseases that affect his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies.

loans.name: Digna Ada Luz

texts.es:
La señora Digna Ada Luz M. se desempeña como maestra de primaria y trabaja en la escuela Marcos Dessys  en la Ciudad de Chinandega, es casada pero vive sola ya que su esposo esta fuera del país habita en el Reparto 12 de Septiembre.

La señora Digna solicitó el crédito para gastos personales servicios básicos y para cancelar deudas y para ayudarle a su familia con gastos.
texts.en:
Sra. Digna Ada Luz M. is an elementary school teacher who works at the Marcos Dessys School in the city of Chinandega. She is married, but she lives alone in the September 12th division because her husband is out of the country.

Sra. Digna is requesting a loan for personal expenses such as basic services, cancellation of debts, and to help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses & cancellation of debts

loans.name: Sagher Qashang Group

texts.en: Nekbakht is the daughter of E., the leader of the Sagher Qashang group. She lives in district six, Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and has six children. She has responsibility for all the members of her household. Her son has a bakery near his house and needs some money. So his mother (Nekbakht) has requested a loan so he can buy more wood and other necessary things for his bakery as he wants to increase his business. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders and AFS in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to buy more wood for his bakery

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: EL SEÑOR JOSE VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO DISTANTE A 40 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ, SU ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL ES LA VENTA DE PAPA SE DEDICA DESDE HACE UN AÑO A ESTA ACTIVIDAD A LA QUE TAMBIEN SE DEDICA SU ESPOSA, TIENE 2 HIJO LOS CUALES ESTAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR,  COMPRAN PAPA DE LOS AGRICULTORES Y LO REVENDEN EN LA CIUDAD DE sANTA CRUZ, TIENEN UN AUTO DONDE TRANSPORTA SU PRODUCTO PARA COMERCIALIZARLO,  TENIENDO ASI ALGO DE GANANACIAS, EN SUS TIEMPO LIBRES SE DEDICA AL TRANSPORTE DE PERSONA EN LA COMUNIDAD, SE DEDICA A ESTAS DOS ACTIVIDADES YA QUE ES SU FUENTE DE INGRESOS PARA MANTENER A SU FAMILIA,  EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO SOLICITADO ES PARA HACERLE MANTENIMIENTO A SU VEHICULO, SE SIENTE AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER POR BRINADARLE SU APOYO FINANCIERO.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose lives in the town of El Torno, which is 40km from the city of Santa Cruz. He and his wife have been selling potatoes for a year. They have two children who attend school. Jose buys potatoes from the farmers and sells them in Santa Cruz. He owns a vehicle that is used to transport the products that he will sell.

To earn extra money, Jose provides passenger transport services within the community during his free time. These two business activities are the source of income necessary to support his family. The loan he requested will be used to pay for vehicle maintenance. Jose is grateful to Emprender for providing this financial support.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es: EL SR. LUIS VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO EN EL BARRIO SAN MARTIN EN LA CASA DE SU PADRE, SU ESPOSA CON LA CUAL TIENE UN HIJO PEQUEÑO, LE AYUDA EN LA CARPINTERIA, SU DESEO ES PODER TENER SU PROPIA CASA PARA CRIAR ADECUADAMENTE A SU PEQUEÑO HIJO PRIMOGENITO, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO SOLICITADO ES PARA COMPRAR MADERA PARA SU NEGOCIO, SE SIENTE AGRADECIDO CON LA INSTITUCION LA CUAL LE DIO UNA MANO PARA TENER UN CAPITAL PROPIO, Y ASI SEGUIR MANTENIENDO A SU FAMILIA, YA QUE SU TRABAJO ES SU UNICA FUENTE DE INGRESO.
texts.en:
Luis lives in his father’s house in the San Martin neighborhood of the town of El Torno. His wife, with whom he has a young son, helps him with his carpentry. He dreams of having his own home where he can properly raise his firstborn son.
The requested loan will be used to buy wood for his business. His work is his only source of income, so he is grateful to this institution for helping him have capital of his own to provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Katusenvule Development Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
When you clock up fifty years, many people, especially in Africa, write you off as ineffectual and, even worse, as a person of straw. For one to fight this stereotype, requires lots of summoned-up courage and resolve.

50-year-old K. Ronah banked on the above to take root in her retail shop in Buloba, Lugazi. She has been a stickler for hard work for the last eight years since her business has been operational. Because of this she has made lots of strides in effectively providing for her family’s welfare on the steady profits she has been making. In a week, she says she makes profits that amount to 30,000 shillings.

Ronah started off her business with savings from her farming business which is now on a small scale. With this loan, she says she wants to buy more general merchandise retail items like soap and sugar for her store.

loans.use: To purchase more general merchandise like soap and sugar for her store

loans.name: Elsa Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina es socia del banquito Génesis, vive en San pedro del cebollar, que es un prestigioso lugar de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por ser la cuna de escritores, esta bañada por sus cuatro ríos, es una ciudad especial gracias a sus iglesias, su centro histórico, y su gente.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 31 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos de 10 y 9 años de edad que estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo labora como empleado de una fábrica, con el esfuerzo conyugal han llegado tener  casa propia.
 
La Señora Catalina se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, desde que se inicio con los créditos de la fundación se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogos, fue incentivada por sus amigas para que comience en este negocio, se encuentra hace tres ciclos en la fundación, con ellos ha iniciado su negocio y da gracias a su hermana que le invitó a ser socia de nuestro grupo.

 Su nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar para la compra de más ropa para vender en su negocio y así de esta forma obtener más ganancias para llevar el pan de cada día a su casa.

 El sueño de nuestra socia es viajar a los Estados Unidos para conocer una nueva cultura.
texts.en:
Sra. Catalina is a member of the Genesis Communal Bank. She lives in San Pedro del Cebollar, which is a prestigious area of the city of Cuenca. The city is surrounded by four rivers and known for being the birthplace of writers. This place is special because of its churches, its historical center, and its people.

Catalina is 31 years old, married, has two children (ages 10 and 9) who are students at the local school. Her husband is a factory employee. After some effort, they were able to acquire their own home.

Sra. Catalina is dedicated to her household activities. Since she started receiving loans from Fundación ESPOIR, Catalina has been selling clothes through catalogs. Her friends convinced her to start this business. She has participated in three loan cycle with the Foundation, which helped her start her business. Her sister is the person who invited her to become a member of this group.

This new loan will be used to buy more clothing to sell in her business, which will allow her to generate more income so that she can provide for her daily household needs. Catalina dreams of traveling to the United States so that she can learn a new culture.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers, T-shirts, blouses, dresses, and pajamas

loans.name: Saruul-Erdene

texts.en:
Saruul-Erdene D. is 47 years old and lives with his wife and four children, aged between 3 and 19, in Hentiy province, eastern of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a house. His eldest son is disabled, the middle two children attend a local middle school, and the youngest daughter goes to a local kindergarten. 

Saruul-Erdene and his wife work together repairing tires and cars next to their house. The couple owns a car repair service which they began in 2007 and their work is very popular because their work is fast and of high quality. This couple works hard to provide for their children and improve the quality of their lives with education. Saruul-Erdene is a hard-working and creative, modest person that says, " I have been working as a driver for ages and now am glad to repair cars and make the other drivers happy ".  

He is requesting a 1,500,000 Mongolian tugrug (MNT) loan in order to purchase rubber, tools, equipment and new tires for his car repair business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Our God Is Good. Group

texts.en:
Isaac H., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Our God Is Good.

He is 35 years old, single, and has one child who is 10 years old. He was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to financial difficulty.   

For 10 years, he has been operating a barber shop in Redlight Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 10,000 LRD portion of this 38,000 LRD group loan to buy more barber shop products such as a hair dryer, shampoo, oil shine and gel. 

He describes himself as a devoted family man. His dream is to grow his business and build a shop.

loans.use: To buy more barber shop products such as shampoo, oil shine, gel, etc.

loans.name: Sopecheikh Makhfou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPECHEIKH MAKHFOU a vu le jour en décembre 2009. Il est composé de 10 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles liées par des liens affectifs, de parenté et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de DVF GUEOUL

Madame Fatou N., debout au second rang sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 2 autres enfants confiés par des proches. 

Elle fait du commerce. Elle se rend à Dakar acheter des articles divers pour revendre lors du marché hebdomadaire de son quartier. 

Avec son crédit elle va acheter des pochettes, des sacs à main pour dame, des chaussures etc..

Ses bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer son épargne et de perdre en charge ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sopecheikh Makhfou has been created in December 2009. It is composed of 9 women all living in the same neighborhood. They are all neighbors and relatives or friends. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of DVF Gueoul. Mrs. Fatou N., second row (standing) in the photo, is the group’s leader. She is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of 6 children. She also has 2 other children in her care, entrusted to her by family members. She is an entrepreneur. She travels to Dakar to purchase miscellaneous items to resell them at her local weekly market. With her credit, she would like to buy plastic pouches, women’s handbags, shoes etc. Her revenues allow her to bolster her savings and to provide for her personal needs.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her business capital

loans.name: Angel Brever

texts.es:
Ángel de 46 años, es mecánico de motocicletas y también vende repuestos, vive en una zona  periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil. tiene dos hijos de 19 y 17 años. 

El tenia una tienda de víveres pero como quería el y su esposa tener mas ingresos decidieron vender repuestos de motocicletas. Poco a poco Ángel aprendió a reparar motocicletas y a vender los repuesto, ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una caja de cambio y válvulas para las motocicletas, en el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Ángel, age 46, is a motorcycle mechanic and also sells spare parts. He lives in a periurban area on the outskirts of Guayaquil. He has two children ages 19 and 17. He used to have a grocery store, but since he and his wife wanted to have more income they decided to sell spare motorcycle parts. Bit by bit Angel learned to repair motorcycles and sell the spare parts. He now works from 8 am to 5 pm every day. With this loan he wants to buy a gearbox and valves for the motorcycles. In the future he wants to expand his business and improve the structure of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: gear box, ball valve

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter, de 29 años, vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de ellos y de sus hermanos, todos juntos habitan en una modesta vivienda de material noble ubicada en un populoso barrio al norte de la ciudad. Este emprendedor joven se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi, durante el día, dice que escogió este horario porque trabajar en la noche es más peligroso. Aunque no tiene hijos aún se esfuerza a diario, para ayudar en algo a sus padres en los constantes gastos del hogar, y también para terminar con la construcción de su casa. Trabaja con clientes fijos y nuevos, por rutas cortas, ya que sabe que así se obtiene mayores ganancias, y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es compartir experiencias con sus ocasionales pasajeros, además se distrae bastante viendo las calles y las personas. Tiene grandes planes por concretar, uno de ellos es, comprar un auto para rentarlo, de esta manera espera obtener mejores ganancias. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente para no defraudar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Walter tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en el mantenimiento mecánico de su auto, ya que lo requiere con urgencia para poder trabajar tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Walter, 29, lives with his parents and siblings in their house which is a modest house made from substantial materials located in a crowded neighborhood in the north part of the city. This enterprising young man provides taxi services during the day. He says he selected this work schedule because working at night is more dangerous. Although he doesn’t have any children he works hard daily to help his parents with the constant household expenses and to finish building their house. He works with both new and regular customers on short routes because that means higher profits. What he likes best about his work is sharing experiences with his passengers and he enjoys looking at the streets and the people. He has a lot of plans in the works. One of them is to buy a car to lease it out thereby earning better profits. This is his 2nd loan with MFP and he promises to repay punctually so as not to disappoint all the people that made the loan possible which will allow him to keep working in search of progress. Walter will use the funds for vehicle maintenance and repair because it has some urgent work that needs to be done in order to be able to work worry-free.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Teresa De Lourdes

texts.es:
Teresa de 46 años, es vendedora informal de confites y dulces en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive con su hijo de 12 años en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales.

Comenzó con su negocio ya que todos los días le tenia que comprar para la escuela a su hijo confites, opto por comprar en una cantidad grande confites y dulces y venderlos para tener un ingreso adicional. Poco a poco a podido incrementar su mercadería. Trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer para darle una mejor vida a sus hijos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar lácteos, confites para surtir mas su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener de alquiler locales para tener un ingreso adicional.
texts.en:
Teresa, 46, sells sweets and candy informally in front of her house. She lives with her 12 year old son in an urban zone noted for most of its inhabitants being informal merchants. She started her business because she had to buy her son snacks daily to take to school. She opted to buy a large quantity of snacks and candy to sell and have an extra source of income. Gradually she was able to increase her merchandise. She works every day from very early in the morning until nightfall to provide her children with a better life. The loan will be used to buy dairy products and sweets to better stock her business. In the future she’d like to have locales to rent as an additional source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For dairy products and sweets.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 54-year-old married man with 6 children and has 4 other dependents. He lives in his own residential house with 4 family members. His family goal is to have educated children and a farm. His home address is Masindi, Uganda. 

He is into the transportation business and has been running it for one year. He bought the vehicle using his retirement package. He faces a challenge of high fuel prices and obtaining vehicle spare parts. In future he wishes to have a fleet of trucks and he wants the loan to purchase new tyres for his vehicle.

loans.use: Buying tyres for his vehicle for transport business

loans.name: United Women For Development Group

texts.en:
Ruth Kabbeh, who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called United Women For Development. She is 41 years old, married, and has four children who are between the ages of 8 to 26 years. She was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to a lack of financial support. She describes herself as a faithful woman.

For 5 years, she has been selling drinks (liquor) in Coca Cola Factory Community outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more crates of drinks. Her dreams are to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina E. is a rice vendor, buying and selling rice at both the wholesale and retail level. Her husband, Raymundo E., age 44, works as a rice mill Operator to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 14 and 17 years old. The family lives in Sitio Cantonog, Brgy. Linao, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental

Gina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired toward something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gina has been working hard and incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourteenth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stocks to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and meet her family needs. 

Gina E. is truly a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Dungganon is a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable." Through this alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities they could not even have dreamed of. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
This is Cheryl A., 40, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Leonardo, a pedicab driver, and together they have a child who helps her with the business. By the grace of God, Cheryl has managed to support her child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Cheryl operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at piecemeal rates. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Cheryl dreams of being able to finish college education of her children with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen N. lives in the Busega neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has one child who is not in school. 

Hellen sells charcoal. She has been in this business for 2 years and she works 7 days a week. Hellen sells her products from home. Hellen has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more charcoal.her main business challenge is transporting the charcoal from Natete to her home in Busega.  She hopes to start going to villages of Luwero for charcoal. Hellen lives in a home that she owns with electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Colombus

texts.en: 28 year old Colombus R. is a courteous, hard working and good natured business man. For the last 10 years he has been selling bananas in Kanywambogo Market-Ibanda. Before that he was selling mostly goats. Colombus is happily married and has 1 child.  To supplement his 180,000 monthly profits, he also sells goats. With this loan, Colombus says he is going to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Daisy forma parte del banco comunal “Creciendo hacia el Futuro” de la ciudad de Rancagua.  Ella tiene un kiosco en un colegio de la ciudad, el cual atiende desde hace 1 año. También ofrece servicios de banquetería y comida típica en una parte del terreno de su casa, desde hace unos 10 años. Daisy le da trabajo a su prima para que le ayude en sus dos negocios y a una compañera,  cuando tiene que atender algún evento. Todas son parte de Fondo Esperanza. Además cocina, para vender en esta época de Navidad, pan de pascua y pavos asados, por encargos. A fines de diciembre reemplazará los pavos por mote con huesillos. 
La casa de Daisy, la cual es muy antigua, sufrió varios daños debido al terremoto del pasado 27 de febrero, por lo que la está reparando de a poco. 
Con este préstamo comprará cerámica para su cocina,  alimentos  e ingredientes para preparar sus productos.
Daisy trabaja todos los días de la semana y es el único sustento económico de su hogar. Tiene una hija que está en 3º año de la universidad y estudia ingeniería comercial. 
Su sueño es hacer un centro de eventos en su casa, ya que por la extensión del terreno que ocupa, tendría capacidad para atender a 200 personas. Ahora por falta de infraestructura, puede atender solo a 50 personas.
Para Daisy Fondo Esperanza ha sido un gran apoyo material y emocional, ya que gracias a los préstamos ha mantenido su negocio.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
Daisy is a member of the "Creciendo hacia el Futuro" (Growing towards the Future) community bank which is located in the city of Rancagua.  She has a kiosk in a local school where she has been working for 1 year.  She has also been offering catering services and traditional meals on her property for 10 years.

Daisy employs her cousin to help her in her two businesses and a friend when she has to serve at an event.  They are all members of Fondo Esperanza.  Daisy also bakes panettone and roast turkey to order to sell during the Christmas period.  At the beginning of December, she replaces her turkeys with 'mote con huesillos' (a traditional Chilean summer drink).

Daisy's home, which is very old, suffered damage in the February 27th earthquake and she is repairing it bit by bit.  She will use this loan to buy ceramics for her kitchen and food and ingredients for preparing her products.  Daisy works every day of the week and she is the only one who financially supports her household.  She has a daughter who is in her third year at university, studying commercial engineering.

Daisy's dream is to set up an events center in her home because her plot of land is large and she would have room for 200 people.  Right now, as she lacks infrastructure, she can only serve 50 people.  For Daisy, Fondo Esperanza has been a great material and emotional support since their loans have enabled her to keep her business running.

The city of Rancagua is located in Libertador Bernardo O'Higgins region.  It is a modern city that controls the main production and export process for Chilean agricultural and wine products.  It is also a mining city.  The biggest underground mine in the world, 'El Teniente' is found in its mountain range, with 4,500km of tunnels.

loans.use: Ceramics, food and ingredients

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen N. is 45 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school. Stephen has a mixed farm in Nyamira town, western Kenya that produces tea, milk, vegetables and maize that are all sold locally. He has been in the farming business for eighteen years now. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater to the basic needs of his family.

Stephen has requested a loan of 35,000 KES through Kiva’s partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve his family's living conditions. He would like to expand his tea plantation and own at least four dairy cows in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mrs. Sinat Auk Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of thirteen people who are living in A Cheang village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sinat A. is a village bank president who has been selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for varied ways to improve their family's living situation. She is a noodle seller in a local village where she is able to earn some profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Norn Ai, is a construction worker. She wants to start selling fish, but does not have a bicycle for transportation. Mrs. Sinat A. is taking a loan to buy a bicycle. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in a local school. The youngest child is one year old.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle for transportation to sell fish

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia tiene 48 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú.  Felicia se dedica a la venta de fruta que trae de la ciudad de Yanatile. Ya son 7 años que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien,  ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer el mantenimiento de su casa. Su sueño de Felicia es abrir un restaurante.
     
Felicia pertenece al banco comunal “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Felicia is 48 years old, has three children, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. She sells fruit that is brought in from the city of Yanatile. Felicia has been in this business for seven years and has done very well. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to maintain her home. Her dream is to open a restaurant.

Felicia belongs to the Communal Bank “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” (Unity, Strength, and Friendship). She is grateful for the opportunity provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Pay for home maintenance

loans.name: Kaiyrgul's Group

texts.en:
Kaiyrgul K. is the treasurer of this group. She is 24 years old and divorced. She has a newborn baby and she also looks after two younger brothers and a sister. All of them study at school.

Five years ago, with the initial investment of 30,000 KGS, she started to sell flour for making money. Now her monthly profit is approximately $212. This profit made it possible for her to purchase a refrigerator and to improve the family’s living conditions. 

With money received from the loan she wants to increase the turnover of her business and purchase more flour for resale. In the future she plans to purchase a truck in order to reduce transportation expenditures. 
  
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more flour to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a member of the Kitekitu group in Faulu Kenya. He operates a boda boda (motorbike) transport business. George has two years of experience in the business and employs two people. Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, George has been motivated to work hard in his business. He is looking forward to opening other business outlets. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorbike

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam is married and is a father of three children.  He is the only income earner for his family.   His wife is not working and is bringing up their children at home.  Rustam is engaged in animal husbandry. He has been in this business for 5 years. He purchases cattle and feeds them for a certain period of time, then sells them in the markets of Yavan, Sultonobod and Rudaki.   Rustam would like to get a loan of US$1000 to purchase more cattle, which will allow him to expand this business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: buy more cattle for his business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma C. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old and married, with 9 adult-aged children. To make a living, Norma operates a specialized retail store, where she sells medicinal wine and a variety of powdered juice drinks. Norma has been engaged in her business for more than 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Norma joined HSPFI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP, to be used to purchase additional products such as beverages and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as beverages and canned goods

loans.name: Aynur

texts.en:
Aynur Q., age 45, carries out her daily work herding her grazing cattle in an area near the city of Bilasuvar, where she is from. She and her husband have been dedicated to this occupation for the last six years. This is the only financial income for the family. Aynur is the dedicated mother of three children.

Aynur wishes to buy calves for breeding and so that she can increase monthly turnover. She is therefore asking for a loan of 1,000 AZN. She promises to repay on time.

loans.use: to purchase two calves for breeding

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is a 30-year-old mother of a two-month-old and a four-year-old, the latter child already attending school. Clarisse owns a restaurant serving a variety of foods; she also charges phones in exchange for money and also owns a small shop selling items such as biscuits, soap, sugar, etc. Operating these businesses for the past two years has enabled her meet the needs of her family.

Clarisse is now requesting a loan to buy more food for her restaurant and plans to buy a cow as a source of milk. She hopes to soon begin building her family home.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 46 years old and live in West Point. She has two children aged 25 and 30. Only one of them attends school. For the past seven years Hawa has been selling traditional cloth (lappa) in the local market. She enjoys her work there. She is requesting a loan to purchase more lappa for her business; she plans to buy some land and build a house on it in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more Lappa (a traditional cloth) for her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 34 años de edad convive con oscar  de 32, con quien tiene dos bellas hijas que, son los regalos mas preciados que lo pudiera haber dado la vida, y por quienes esta dispuesta a  luchar y dar la vida si es que fuera posible. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el centro poblado de natividad del distrito de Pichari. Cuando hace 20 años el país atravesaba un crisis social,  rosa aún era una niña de 14 años y en ese tiempo perdió a sus padres, por lo que dejó los estudios y tuvo que trabajar como empleada del hogar  para poder sobrevivir, especializándose en la preparación de comidas. Hoy se ha convertido en su fuente de ingresos económicos, es así que prepara diversos potajes, por lo que sus clientes no dudan en ir a consumir uno de ellos. Día a día trabaja y crea nuevos platos,  dándoles a sus comensales un trato amable y cordial deseándoles un pronto retorno. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP por lo que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con la preparación de comida. Rosa  es una mujer que le pone ese entusiasmo y espíritu de emprendedor en su banco comunal. Con los tres mil nuevos soles comprará utensilios de cocina y mejorar el ambiente de su restaurante.
texts.en:
Rosa is 34 years old and in a common-law marriage with Oscar, age 32. They have two beautiful daughters who are the most precious gifts she has in life and for whom she is willing to fight and provide the best life possible. Rosa and her family live in their own home in the central village of Natividad in the District of Pichari. Twenty years ago, when the country was enduring a social crisis, Rosa was 14 years old when she lost her parents. She had to quit school and work as a housekeeper in order to survive. As part of her job, she learned how to prepare food and now she uses that skill to earn an income. Rosa prepares different dishes and her customers do not hesitate to try at least one of them. She works every day and creates new dishes. Rosa provides her customers with friendly service in hopes that they will return soon.

This is her second loan with MFP. She hopes that everyone will support her so that she can continue preparing her food. Rosa is an enthusiastic woman and a spirited entrepreneur in her Communal Bank. Her loan of 3000 PEN will be used to buy cooking utensils and pay for improvements to the ambience of her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils and to make improvements to her restaurant.

loans.name: Nexaida

texts.es: Nexaida de 22 años de edad, convive con Richard de 25 años de edad quienes habitan en una casa alquilada. Por sus venas corre sangre de agricultor, ya que generalmente en su comunidad todos se dedican a dicha actividad. Actualmente se dedica a cultivar cacao, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus 4 hijos y durante el tiempo de cosecha tiene que contratar peones. Normalmente su producto lo vende en los Centros de Acopio, en la  localidad de Pichari. En adelante piensa comprar más terrenos, para así producir en grandes volúmenes y por consiguiente vender su producto a un  buen precio. El único inconveniente que ella tiene es que su parcela se encuentra en un lugar accidentado que no tiene acceso de movilidad y le es muy forzoso el  trasladar sus productos cosechados. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP por lo que ella se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles contratará peones para que realicen la limpieza de su parcela agrícola.
texts.en:
Nexaida is 22 years old and in a common-law marriage with Richard, age 25. They live in a rented house. The blood of a farmer runs through her veins since almost everyone in her community engages in agriculture. Nexaida currently grows cacao. Occasionally she has the help of her four children, but she must hire workers during the harvest season. She normally sells her products at the collection centers in the town of Pichari. Going forward, Nexaida plans to buy more land so that she can produce in greater volumes and continue selling her products at a good price. Her only challenge at the moment is a parcel of land that she owns that is located in a rugged area not accessible by vehicle. As a result, she is not able to transport her harvested products.

This will be her second loan with MFP. Nexaida promises to submit her payments on time. The loan of 2000 PEN will be used to hire workers to clear her parcel of farmland.

loans.use: to pay workers to clear her farmland.

loans.name: Lisungi Plus Group

texts.en:
Charlotte is the leader of the Community Bank named “Lisungi Plus”, which is composed of 15 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.
Charlotte is 46 years old, a widow and the mother of ten children, whose ages range between 9 and 28 years old. Six of her children attend school. Charlotte has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2007. She operates a general store and sells prepaid cards in the mid-west of Kinshasa. She works hard and employs good management skills in order to realize her dream of someday becoming a main provider in her environment. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business, which currently earns her $100 per week. Charlotte has already obtained and correctly repaid 11 loans from microfinance institution and Kiva partner, HOPE DRC. She will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by buying one sack of flour, one sack of sugar, vegetable oil and some prepaid cards in bulk to resell at a profit.

loans.use: to increase her store’s stock by buying one sack of flour, one sack of sugar, vegetable oil and some prepaid cards in bulk for reselling at profit.

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en:
At the very young age of 20, Erwin engaged in planting and harvesting rice for future sale. He has been doing this for over a year. As a farmer working in the Philippines, he earns the average of 60,000 PHP (~$1410) every harvest season. He plants and harvests rice twice a year, every April and November.

Erwin is asking for a loan to buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides for his farming to improve his crop production. In the future, he hopes to strengthen his business and generate more income from farming to maintain economic stability.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides.

loans.name: Mesías Hugo

texts.es:
Mesías tiene 28 años vive en T. junto a su madre y hermano, no tiene hijos y se describe como una persona trabajadora, tranquila, amistosa, dedicada y preocupado por su familia.

Trabaja en agricultura en el cultivo de papas solo, empezó a trabajar como jornalero y cuando tuvo experiencia decidió trabajar su propia tierra, empezó con su labor hace 11 años.

Realiza créditos a FODEMI desde hace 2 años este sería su tercer crédito, este prestamo lo va a utilizar en la compra de abono para el sembrío de papas que están de 4 meses de siembre.

Con la ayuda de este préstamo mejoraría su producción y sus ventas y a la vez mejoraría la calidad de vida de el y el de su familia, aspira llegar a comprar una casa ya que ellos viven arrendando, también comprar electrodomésticos para su casa.
texts.en:
Mesías is 28 years old and lives in T. with his mother and brother.  He doesn't have any children and is described as a hard worker, quiet, friendly, dedicated and concerned about his family.

He works in agriculture in the cultivation of solely potatoes.  He began working as a laborer and when he had experience he decided to work his own land. Mesías began his work 11 years ago.

He has been getting loans from FODEMI for 2 years, this would be his third loan.  He will use this loan to buy fertilizer for planting potatoes that are within 4 months of sowing.

With the help of this loan, Mesías would improve his production and sales and also improve the quality of life for his family.  He aspires to buy a house because they are leasing.  He also wants to buy appliances for his home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for planting potatoes.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Aida has a retail shop where she sells home products like kitchen utensils, curtains & bed sheets. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy home products for sell.

Aida is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy home products to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 36 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Mbarara region of Uganda.  He is single and has 2 children. Both of his children are currently in school.  Paul has a business of a small retail shop, which he has had for 2 years.         

To help expand his business, Paul has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like salt and sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, he hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, he hopes to expand his business.    Paul is a member of BRAC’s Small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by increasing his capital.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like salt and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Met

texts.en:
Met is a weaver, while her husband is a farmer. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2000 and have two children, a son and a daughter. Both children are in school. 

Met is applying for another loan of US$500 to buy one more cow to raise. 

Photo: Met and her husband.

loans.use: To buy one more cow to raise.

loans.name: Joann

texts.en:
Joann is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children.  Joann has a shop that sells vegetables & spices. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy vegetables & spices to sell.  Joann has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables & spices to sell

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 34-year-old young woman. She is married and has three sons. Her husband has a store for selling generators where there is high demand for generators. This is the only source of income for the family. Lubna wants to help her husband in the purchase of more generators for sale but she does not have enough money so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Lubna gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to help her husband to sell more, increase his income and provide his family with better living conditions. Lubna is a conservative woman so her husband is photographed instead next to his store.


About this loan product:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase more generators for sale.

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Rem, 43 years old, sells vegetables, earning $8 per day. Her husband plants vegetables, earning $1 per day. The couple has five children: four are in school and one works in the garment factory, earning $3 per day. Each month, Rem spends $60 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on school fees, $20 on transportation and $20 on other expenses.

Rem would like to request a loan of $700 to buy vegetables to sell. She wants to expand her vegetable store to sell more kinds of vegetables when she has enough money. Rem wants to support her children to study until they finish university.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ntetia

texts.en:
Ntetia is a very hard-working woman who practices mixed farming in Olokurto-Narok, Kenya. She has been in this business for over five years and earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000. 

She is 34 years old and married to Jackson, also a farmer. They have two children.
