El Esposo de la Sra. Silvia y sus hijos son los que se encargan de la confección de las chamarras y doña Silvia se encarga de la venta de las chamarras, la misma que lo realiza de la siguiente manera, las lleva a vender en los departamentos de Potosí Tarija y Sucre.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de tela paño por rollos en diferentes colores ya que de esa manera puede reducir el costo del material y por ende incrementar el margen de ganancia por chamarra, la sra. Silvia se encuentra muy contenta ya que toda la familia trabaja en este negocio es una persona muy trabajadora siempre piensa en el bienestar de toda su familia, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Siliva lives in her own home in Villa Nuevo Potosí. She is 47 years old and is married to Don Victor. They have three children who are studying at the university. Her family works together manufacturing jackets.

Silvia’s husband and her children are responsible for manufacturing the jackets, while she is in charge of selling them. She takes her products to the Departments of Potosí Tarija and Sucre to sell.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rolls of woven fabric in different colors so that she can reduce the cost of the material and increase her profit margin per jacket. Sra. Silvia is very happy that all of her family works in this business. She is a hardworking woman who is always thinking about the welfare of her entire family. Silvia is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in her by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rolls of fabric

loans.name: Lorta Uaquene

texts.pt:
Lorta Uaquene N. nasceu em Inhambane, província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos, dos quais 3 perderam a vida um ainda vivo e empregado numa empresa privada. Vive na casa própria com seu filho, nora e seus 3 netos que vão a escola.   

Com 15 anos Lorta inicia seus estudos, faz a 2ª classe do antigo sistema e de seguida esta fica gravida. Fica muito desesperada após a morte dos seus filhos no tempo da guerra, sua irmã convida lhe para morar com ela no Distrito de Namaacha na fronteira da suazilândia, após sua chegada começa a trabalhar como empregada doméstica. 

Com o fundo colectado ela inicia seu próprio negócio e constroi sua casa com o rendimento ganho nos negócios, mas devido aos preparativos do casamento do seu filho ela fica na beira da falência e pede empréstimo a Hluvuku no valor de 8.000.00mt para reforçar o seu negócio. tem vendido 2 vezes por semana quartas e sabados no Mercado Informal onde há intercâmbio de produtos vindo de paises fora tem de lucro 5.000.00mt que gasta nas dispesas da casa e ainda consegue poupar algum.

 Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Lorta na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva.O primeiro 8.000.00.mt foi usado para reforçar o seu negocio, o segundo de 10.000.00mt foi usado para aumentar a quantidade do seu stock, e este terceiro de 15.000.00mt serao para a mesma finalidade que é a compra de fardo de roupa usada diversa. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir a casa do seu único filho.
texts.en:
Lorta Uaquene N. was born in the district of Inhambane, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. Lorta is unmarried and had 4 children. Three of her children died, but one still lives and is employed at a private firm. She lives in her own home with her son, her daughter-in-law, and her 3 grandchildren, all of whom attend school. At age 15, Lorta began her studies, and finished the 2nd year of secondary school under the old education system. After this she became pregnant. After her children died during the Mozambican Civil War, she became despondent. Her sister invited Lorta to live with her in the district of Namaacha on the border with Swaziland. After moving there she began to work as a domestic servant. With her earnings, Lorta started her own business, and then built a house with the profit from that enterprise. However, due to expenses related to her son’s wedding she is close to bankruptcy. For this reason she is asking for a loan in the amount of 8000 meticais to shore up her business. She works two days a week, Wednesdays and Saturdays, selling at an unofficial market where people trade in imported goods. She earns about 5000 meticais per month and uses this income to cover household expenses. She also saves some each month. This is Lorta’s 3rd loan with Hluvuku and her 2nd with Kiva. The first loan, in the amount of 8000 meticais, was used to help shore up her business. The second, in the amount of 10,000 meticais, was used to increase her stock of merchandise. This third loan, for 15,000 meticais, will be used for the same purpose, to buy packs of used clothing for resale. Lorta is confident that she will repay this loan even sooner than required so that she can get another loan to finish building a house for her son.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of packs of used clothing

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina A. is single and has no formal education. She is a hairdresser in Abura. She has been a hairdresser for 13 years. She uses her revenue to take care of herself. She is going to use this loan to purchase more hair products for her customers' hair.  Faustina plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to buy a steam dryer.

loans.use: To purchase more hair products to use for her customers' hair

loans.name: Mrs. Srorn Port Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people make up this village bank loan located in Koun Chreae village in Kandal province. The group loan is headed by Mrs. Srorn P., a village bank president. All the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's living conditions. 


Mrs. Srorn P. is 45 years old and is a Khmer cake maker. She is also a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to supP. her family. She currently faces a problem in that it is time to grow rice but she does not have enough money to do this. She is, therefore, applying for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer and to hire a plow. 


She is a widow with two children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the other is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer, and to hire a plow

loans.name: Oripha

texts.en:
Oripha is 48 years old. She is a widowed mother of 2 children, ages 12 and 16, with both children attending school. She has been operating her mixed farm for 10 years in Kisii town, Western Kenya. She solely depends on the income from her farming activities to cater for the needs of her family.

Her biggest challenges have been lack of animal feeds, natural calamities and diseases, and the high competition in the market which affect her production.

Oripha has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES. 60,000 to purchase a water tank for collecting water for her dairy cows. She believes that this water tank will help increase her production. 

In the future, she hopes to purchase a quality dairy cow that will produce 60 litres of milk daily. She is grateful to Juhudi for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Rosio

texts.es:
La señora Rosio L. M. tiene 28 años y está casada hace 5 años con el señor Willy Andres Ruiz Vaca con el cual tienen dos hijos Wendy de 9 y Rodrigo  de 3 años. Viven en su casa propia ubicada en el Barrio Noel Kenf Mercado en la calle Los Tajibos en la ciudad de Santa Cruz.

Esta pareja tienen una pequeña vidriera y ambos trabajan en la misma desde hace dos años haciendo trabajos de carpintería de aluminio y otros. Ella trabaja con su hijo en el lugar ya que no cuenta con niñera y los ingresos no le alcanzan para poder costear una y no se anima a dejarlo solo por su corta edad. Por el incremento en el precio del vidrio y del aluminio no les ha alcanzado para comprar material y su producción está empezando a estancarse por este motivo necesita el préstamo para poder comprar material y así poder satisfacer todos los pedidos que tiene.

El Mayor sueño que tienen es poder incrementar sus ingresos y de esa manera poder darle a su hijo todas las comodidades que ellos no pudieron tener de pequeños.
texts.en:
Rosio L. M. is 28 and has been married to Willy Andres Ruiz Vaca for five years. They have two children together, Wendy age 9 and Rodrigo, age 3. They live in their own home on Los Tabijos road in the Noel Kenf Mercado neighborhood in the city of Santa Cruz. This couple has a glass and window shop where they have both worked for the past 2 years performing carpentry and aluminum work amongst others. She works with her child alongside since the shop since they can't afford a baby sitter and she fears leaving him alone because of his age. The increased cost of glass and aluminum has made it difficult to buy material and their production is starting to drop off. For that reason they need a loan to buy material and fill all their orders. Their greatest dream is to increase their income and so be able to give their son all the comforts they didn't have as children.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase glass and aluminum for shop

loans.name: Faimasasa

texts.en:
Faimasasa S. is 51 and married with seven children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Faimasasa has 3 years of experience in this business.  Faimasasa needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 320 talas or US $133 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2010, Faimasasa joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faimasasa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es: Yessica V. B. y su esposo desde hace un año se dedican a la venta de pan de elote y de maíz que ellos mismo preparan, su producto lo ofrecen en cada negocio del centro de la ciudad, este es llamado comida campirana que provienen de la ciudad que vivían. Este préstamo lo desea utilizar para comprar más ingredientes para seguir preparando este suculento pan.
texts.en:
Yessica V. B. has been selling corn bread for the past year, together with her husband. They make the bread themselves and they sell their product to the businesses in the city's downtown. This food product is a country food staple, traditional to the region from where they used to live. This loan will be used to purchase more ingredients to keep making this delicious bread.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es: Enedina tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo  y su hijo en su casa propia. Toda la vida ha estado dedicada a la agricultura y a la crianza D. animales que con mucho esmero ha venido realizando con su esposo con el fin D. sostener a su familia. En la actualidad mantiene las mismas fuerzas y energías para que pueda obtener una excelente cosecha y generen las rentas necesarias. Afirma que le agrada trabajar en esta actividad ya que es lo único que sabe hacer desD. que era un niño, ahora en lo posible comercializa su producción en el mercado mayorista, lugar donD. obtiene mejores ganancias, es por esta razón que desea mejorar sus futuras cosechas. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. sacos D. abono ya que empezará una nueva temporada D. siembra.
texts.en:
Enedina, 53, lives with her husband and her son in her own house. She has been a farmer and has raised animals her entire life. She and her husband have been working very hard to support their family. She still has the same strength and energy to continue working to have an excellent harvest that will produce the necessary profits. She affirms that she likes working in this activity since it’s the only thing she’s known how to do since she was a child. Whenever possible, products are sold in the wholesale market where profits are best. For this reason, she’d like to improve future crops. This is her first loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she can count on financial support. Besides, she likes being part of a communal bank because all the members are people she knows; they are responsible and mutually supportive. She is grateful to all those people who will fund the loan she is asking for that will be so useful for her business’ progress. She will use the requested funds to buy sacks of manure because the new planting season is about to begin.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Comfort Aba

texts.en: Comfort Aba K. A. is married. She sells locally-made buicuits at Elmina. She has junior high educational background. Her husband is a farmer. Comfort uses the income she makes from her sales to help in providing the basic needs of the family.  Comfort will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare her biscuits for sale. With the new revenue from her expanded business, Comfort plans on reinvesting into her business.

loans.use: purchase more ingredients to use to prepare her biscuits for sale

loans.name: Agenlina

texts.en: Agenlina A. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions and is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. Agenlina is 30 years old. She is married and her husband is a business man. She has 5 children and 2 of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: To stock more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg R. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Tosontsengel province, Mongolia. She and her family have been living in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent and fence, for the past 18 years. One of her children attends university and another child studies at the local school. Her husband works as a loader in the meat-processing factory. Oyunchimeg currently operates a small bakery in her town. 

In 2004, she started her bakery business at first making only breads to sell in her home. Today she produces between 20 and 25 types of breads and baked pastries. Her child helps in her business. After years of successful operation, she has managed to expand her business and purchased a new oven for her bakery production. Her earnings have enabled her not only to provide for her family, but also to pay her son's tuition fee. Over the last few years, she was able to improve her family's standard of living by purchasing carpets, a TV set, a ger's cover, etc. 

She is a hard-working woman who is focused on the future growth of her business. She says, “ I have a plan to expand my business and to create a more efficient workplace in the future”. Oyunchimeg is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase and maintain a large amount of flour and supplies for her bakery production.

loans.use: To purchase flour and bakery supplies

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 38 years old, married and the mother of four, aged between 10 and 22 years, all attending school.  She has been a mixed farmer for twenty years. She has one employee. Her products are maize, millet, milk and chickens which she sells locally.

She has requested this loan of Kshs. 30,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. Income generated from this loan  will cater for the children's school fees.  In five years she aspires to acquire a plot of land to build both a house and rental business.

The challenge she faces is poor road infrastructure and low market prices for the milk.  She thanks Juhudi for introducing loan facilities to her.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Mrs. Reab Chheun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Reab C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the nine people who make up the village bank loan. This loan can improve their family living. They are located in Prey Ba Soeng village in Takeo province. 

She is a knitter who earns some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sitha Bev, is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support his family. On this plantation, it is time to grow rice but she does not have enough money to support the crop. So to improve production, Mrs. Reab C. is seeking a loan to do farming this current year. 

She is a mother of two children who are both too young to work or study.

loans.use: To do farming

loans.name: Raphael Kagonye

texts.en:
Raphael is 38 years old. He is married to Ruth and they have four children. He has been in the motorcycle transport business for about five years and earns an income of approx Kshs. 12,000 per month.

He is applying for a second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the first one. He intends to use the loan funds to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. He to use the anticipated profit to expand his business by adding more motocycles. He hopes to improve the living standards of his family and give his children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Mame Fatou Wade Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de MAME FATOU W. a vu le jour lors de son premier financement le 27 Décembre 2010. Il est composé de 40 femmes du même quartier. Elles ont monté leur Banc Villageois par proximité et par relaition de solidarité. 

Madame MAME DIOR C. debout à gauche sur la photo et mise en médaillon est présidente du Banc Villageois. Elle est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge.

Elle fait un petit commercer de tissus et de parfums. 

Le nouveau prêt contracté auprès de CAURIE-MF lui permettra de mieux se lancer dans ce domaine d'activité 

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois "Mame Fatou W." was set up on December 27, 2010, when it entered its first loan cycle. It is composed of 40 members, all living in the same neighborhood. They have set up their Banc Villageois due to ties of neighborhood and solidarity.

Mrs Mame Dior C., standing left in the photo with the locket, chairs the Banc Villageois. She is 35 years old, married and the mother of two children in her care. She has a small cloth and perfume store. Her new loan with Caurie Microfinance will enable her to better progress in this activity. Her objective is to participate in household expenses.

loans.use: To buy cloth and perfume

loans.name: Buri

texts.ru: Нодиров Бури проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 61 года. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Сын на заработках в России. Сам Бури более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. В этом ему помогает жена. На сегодняшний день у него имеется три коровы и два теленка. Его семья обеспечена молоком и молочными продуктами. Еще он занимается продажей молока. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Buri N. lives in the region of Yavan. He is 61 years old. He is married and has five children. His son is working in Russia. Buri has been doing animal  husbandry for more than ten years. He breeds cattle at home for future resale. His wife helps him in this business. Currently he has three cows and two calves. His family is supplied with milk and milk products. Buri also sells the milk. He is taking out the loan to buy large cattle and increase their quantity.

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Elgiza's Group

texts.en:
Elgiza O. is the treasurer for this group. She is 26 and married. Her husband works as an excavator driver. Together they bring up a son and two daughters. Their son goes to school and their daughters are still of pre-school age (under seven). 

Five years ago, with the initial investment of 2000 soms, Elgiza and her husband bought four goats for breeding. Since that time, the family has been  engaged in livestock breeding. With the money received from this loan, Elgiza wants to increase their number of livestock. In the future, Elgiza wants to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia P. is from the village of Bobongan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 59 years old. Remegia is widowed and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Remegia owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members. Remegia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Remegia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remegia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Remegia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-year-old married man from Bint Jbeil. He works in agriculture planting several fruits and vegetables. He also sells olive oil that he gets from his olive trees, in addition to selling firewood in the winter season.
Ali is requesting a loan for the first time from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy an electric saw for his business and renew his license to cut trees. Ali is a hard worker who seeks the best for his family by working more than one job. When he first set up in business, he had problems making contacts and expanding his business. Now he is well known, and most of his customers recommend him. He hopes to expand his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To buy an electric saw and renew his license to cut trees

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Pauline has operated a tailoring business for the past ten years; neighboring members are her potential customers. Pauline faces a major challenge of seasonality. During festive season, the demand is high while during the months of January to May, the demand is low. Pauline will use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase cloth materials for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a 26-year-old, hardworking woman who lives in a rented house in Hoima, Uganda. She is a banking officer and earns a salary from her job. She has not faced any challenges at her work place. Her dream is to educate her siblings and to develop her career. Ruth needs this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Delia Caritina

texts.es:
La Sra Delia. tiene 48 años D. edad, está casada con el señor  Estanislao S. quien es carpintero y le ayuda con  los gastos del hogar, son Curuguateños antiguos. Tienen cinco hijos mayores todos independientes, a quienes han criado con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio.
Delia tiene un copetin, desD. hace mas D. 5 años.  Su esposo era el único que generaba ingresos en la casa,  y con un pequeño capital que había juntado pudieron montar dicha actividad. Hoy día ambos generan ingresos y aportan a la canasta familiar.
Actualmente posee clientela formada, pues su negocio está ubicado frente a Identificaciones donD. concurre mucha gente cada dia.
Necesita el crédito para la compra D. mercaderias como carne, huevos, bebidas y otros.
texts.en:
Delia is 48 years old and married to Estanislao S., a carpenter, and she helps him to pay their living expenses: they are old Curuguateños. They have 5 grown children who all live independently, who were raised with great effort and sacrifice by their parents.

Delia has been running a snack bar for 5 years. Her husband was the only one bringing money into their home, and with the small amount of capital that they had saved, they were able to establish this business. Today they both earn money and contribute to the family bills.

Currently she has a regular client base as her business is located facing the Identificaciones building, where there is a lot of passing traD. each day. She needs the loan to purchase goods such as meat, eggs, drinks and more.

loans.use: For the purchase of goods such as meat, eggs, drinks and more.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine N. lives in the Kisaasi neighbourhood of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 2 children, neither of whom is in school. Justine has a business of a retail shop.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days each week. She also generates additional income through  selling piped water.  Justine has requested for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of rice, sugar, cooking oil, and baking flour. The main business challenges for Justine include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also to own a fully stocked supermarket.  Justine lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include utility bills and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and baking flour.

loans.name: Nizbel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Urubamba donde se encuentra el Santuario Histórico de Machu Picchu (Machu Picchu es considerado como una de las octavas Maravillas de la Humanidad). Cada treinta días se reúne el Banco Comunal “Saywa - Chichubamba”. Este lugar es conocido por sus centros arqueológicos, paisajes hermosa, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nizbel que nació en Espinar (Cusco, Perú), tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen dos hijos. Ella trabaja en el Poder Judicial de la ciudad de Urubamba en el área de limpieza desde las 5h00 de la mañana hasta las 13h00 de lunes a viernes.   

Ella también tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual trabaja junto a su esposo, allí venden todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, el esposo atienda en las mañanas y su esposa por las tardes, además de estos productos también venden verduras y útiles escolares, los productos los compra en la ciudad del Cusco ya que allá le salen más baratos, ciertos productos los recibe en su local.  

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace varios años y le gusta por la confraternidad que hay en el grupo.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y convertirlo en un minimarket también su sueño es construir su casa de material noble.
texts.en:
The city of Urubamba is home to the historic sanctuary of Machu Picchu, which is considered one of the eight Wonders of the World. It is also where the "Saywa - Chichubamba" communal bank meets every thirty days. It is a place known for its archaeological centers and beautiful landscapes, which are widely visited by many domestic and international tourists. It offers a variety of beautiful places and a rich variety of typical regional dishes.

This is where you would meet Ms. Nizbel. She was born in Espinar (Cusco, Perú), is 29 years old, married, and has two children from her marriage. She works from 5:00 AM to 1:00 PM from Monday to Friday, as a janitor for the Judicial Power of the city of Urubamba

She also has a grocery store in her house, which she runs together with her husband. They sell all types of products, like rice, sugar, oils, detergents, and other items. Her husband tends the store in the mornings and Nizbel does so in the afternoons. Aside from the aforementioned products they also sell vegetables and school supplies. They buy products in the city of Cusco, where they sell for cheaper. They also obtain some products locally.

Nizbel is going to use this loan to better stock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausage, and other staple products. She has been in her communal bank for several years and she enjoys it because of the fellowship that exists amongst the group.

Her goals are to continue moving forward with her business and to convert it into a mini-market. She also dreams of constructing her house of more stable materials.

loans.use: stock her store with rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausage, and other staple items

loans.name: Walter

texts.en: Walter is a 24-year-old business man.  He is married and blessed with a one-year-old child.  He was previously selling clothes before he started a hardware shop.  It's one year since he started the business.  He hopes to grow his business in the future.  He has requested 50,000 KES to buy paints, iron sheets, nails and cement.

loans.use: to buy paints, iron sheets, nails and cement.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia es socia del banco comunal Ricardo Palma del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
En los ocho años que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos ha podido abrir un pequeño negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de artículos de abarrotes.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 caja de leche, 1 paquete de harina, 3 casillero de huevos, 1 caja de aceite de medio litro, 1 bolsa de detergente, 1 bolsa de lejía en cojín, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, 1 bolsa de fideo.
Todo su dinero lo invierte en su negocio para poder tener más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, su esposo es profesor de profesión y también ayuda en la atención del negocio.
Manuela Ramos ha sido quien le dió la oportunidad de iniciar su negocio y le  agradece por ser quien confió en su sueño del negocio propio.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a member of the 'Ricardo Palma' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 42 years old, married, and has three children.

During the eight years that she has been working with Manuela Ramos, Cecilia has been able to open her own small business selling groceries.

With her new loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy: 1 crate of milk, 1 packet of flour, 3 trays of eggs, 1 crate of half-liter bottles of oil, 1 bag of detergent, 1 bag of bleach, 1 sack of sugar, 1 sack of rice and 1 bag of noodles.

Cecilia invests all her money in her business so that she can offer more products to her customers.  Her husband is a teacher by profession and also helps serve in the business.

It was Manuela Ramos who gave Cecilia the opportunity to start her business and she is grateful to them for having faith in her dream of owning her own business.

loans.use: to buy milk, rice, sugar, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
Gloria, se dedica al procesamiento y venta de productos lácteos, vive con su hijo de 19 años de edad, es madre soltera, aprendió el negocio por su madre, quien le enseño a elaborar la cuajada, queso, crema y requesón, compra la leche luego la prepara con la pastilla para iniciar el cuajo para el proceso, por las mañanas vende los productos, con los vecinos cercanos, también elabora pan y tamales, para venderlos de forma ambulante, esta ocupación la tiene desde hace 5 años.
Ella necesita un financiamiento para comprarse unos estantes para guardar el queso en el verano y leche para fabricar más, este préstamo le ayudara a  guardar en un lugar adecuado los quesos, uno de sus riesgos es la higiene del lugar, que son el mayor riesgo para dañarse los quesos.
Gloria cuenta con clientela para sus productos, esta es una ventaja que tiene, sueña con crecer en producción para ayudarle a su hijo quien padece de incapacidad física, por lo que quiere muchos cuidados.
texts.en:
Gloria processes and sells dairy products. She is a single mother who lives with her 19-year-old son. Gloria learned this trade from her mother, who taught her how to make curds, cheese, cream, and cottage cheese. She buys the milk and then prepares the enzymes that aid in the processing. Gloria sells her products in the morning to her neighbors who live nearby. She also prepares bread and tamales and sells these products as a street vendor. Gloria has been in business for five years.

She needs a loan to buy some shelves for storing her cheese during the summer and the milk needed for making more products. This loan will help her set aside an adequate place for storing cheeses. One of the risks that she must manage is maintaining a sanitary space. Otherwise, dirty conditions could contaminate the cheese.

Gloria has customers who buy her products, which is advantageous. She dreams of increasing her production so that she can support her son, who has a physical disability and requires constant care.

loans.use: to purchase shelving for storing cheese and milk.

loans.name: Rimah

texts.en:
Rimah is a young woman from Maythalon village near Jenin city in Palestine. She is married and a mother of two daughters and four sons. Rimah took out a loan of $1,000 to purchase plowing tools. Her husband is a farmer and needs to prepare his land but the tools he has are not usable.anymore. Rimah's husband grows seasonal vegetables and wants to start growing fruits and increase the variety of crops he sells to shops in Maythalon.

Rimah is a conservative woman.Therefore. her husband is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase plowing tools

loans.name: Arnelyn

texts.en:
Arnelyn is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. She has a shop that sells generic medicines. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of generic medicines.

Arnelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of generic medicines

loans.name: Washington

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Washington; el tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el es propietario de un carro que hace servicio de taxi, el socio también tiene un negocio de venta de comida que lo realiza su esposa, el negocio de servicio de taxi lo realiza desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de taxi y también mejorar el negocio de venta de comida. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro y también para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, azúcar, carne y verduras para el negocio de venta de comida. 
                                              
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
He is a member of the Santo Domingo Communal Bank, which is located in the district of Cusco, a part of the province and department of Cusco.

This is Mr. Washington, who is 36 years old and lives with his partner and 3 children. This member alternates between providing transportation services--he owns a car in which he provides taxi services--and he owns a food business that his wife runs. He works as a cab driver from 6:00 am until 9:00 pm. With these two businesses, he is able to help his children get ahead. This member wishes to improve both his taxi service and his food business. He is requesting a loan for car maintenance and to purchase cooking ingredients like rice, sugar, meat, and vegetables for his food business.

Mr. Washington is happy about the loan, and he commits to making his payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to give his car maintenance and to purchase cooking products like rice, sugar, meat, and vegetables for his food business.

loans.name: Buena

texts.en:
Buena raises hogs for future sale. She has been doing it for three years. This serves as the source of her income which her family relies on to maintain their basic needs such as food and medicines. She has five children to provide for, especially their education. Buena earns about PHP 5,000 with each pig sale.

She is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs. She needs additional capital for maintaining her hogs in order for her to  offer them for sale at a higher cost when they are ready.

Buena wants to strengthen her business and construct a more convenient pig pen.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita is a 49-year-old widow. Her husband died from cancer of the brain. She has five children to provide for. Despite the difficulty of pursuing their lives alone, she is working hard to grant their daily needs such as food.

Estrelita engages in piggery as her primary source of income. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed for her hogs. She hopes to earn a higher income so that she can save for emergencies. She doesn't want to experience again to loss the one she loves because of lack of finance.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru:
Анна замужем. У них с ее мужем Андреем трое детей. Живут в двух комнатной квартире в городе Ивано-Франковске. Вместе с мужем Анна ведет семейный бизнес.

Анна торгует на центральном продуктовом рынке. Ее торговая  точка находится на въезде в рынок. Анна торгует овощами и фруктами.  У нее большой ассортимент и низкие цены.  Анна целеустремленная и трудолюбивая. Этот бизнес является  главным доходом семьи. Цель Анны дать детям высшее образование.

Анна просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 10,000 гривен на закупку на закупку фруктов к сезону консервации и цитрусовых. Получив доход, она сможет переоформить автомобиль, который они недавно приобрели для бизнеса.
texts.en: Anna is married.  She and her husband Andrey have three children.  They live in a two-room apartment in the town of Ivano-Frankivsk.  Anna and her husband have their own business.  Anna sells vegetables and fruits at the central produce market.  Her retail outlet is located at the market entrance.  She has a wide selection of products and low prices.  Anna is a goal-oriented and hard-working person.  This business is the main source of income for her family.  Anna's goal is to provide her children with a higher education.  Anna is requesting a loan in the sum of 10,000 hryvnia for the purchase of fruits for the pickling season.  Having received an income, she would be able to refinance a vehicle that they purchased for the business.

loans.use: to buy fruits for the pickling season

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children.  Rowena has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Rowena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rowena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 71 years old and married with 9 children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other groceries. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en: Sokhim, 34 years old, is a food seller, and she earns $5 per day. Her husband buys and sells recycled things and earns $5 per day. They have three children, two are studying and one is only three years old. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $18 on electricity, and $30 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $900 to buy karaoke material to start a business. She wants to extend her business and buy more karaoke material when she makes a good income from it.

loans.use: To buy karaoke material for her new business

loans.name: Marie Gorette

texts.en:
Marie is 32 years old with four children between the ages of 3 and 12. Three are currently in school. She is married to a man who is a moto taxi driver.  

She has been running a store for 10 years where she sells different goods and recharges batteries.  

She would like to use the loan to buy more utensils to sell. She would like to use the profits of her business to create savings for her future and build a house for her family. She is looking forward to seeing her business prosper.

loans.use: To buy more utensils for resale.

loans.name: Constancia Belen

texts.es:
La señora Constancia tiene 42 años, vive con su cónyuge quien le ayuda en el negocio y su hija D. 17 años D. edad. 
La señora nos cuenta que tiene una despensa y que para poder empezar con su negocio junto a su pareja tuvieron que ir a trabajar en Asunción como empleados domésticos, y gracias al esfuerzo y el trabajo arduo, juntaron un capital con el cual montaron su negocio. Gracias al espíritu emprendedor pudieron ir creciendo hoy en día es uno D. los lugares más concurridos D. la ciudad gracias a la buena atención y a la amabilidad por parte D. los mismos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. fideos, arroz, azúcar, bebidas y otros productos para abastecer su local. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
Constancia is 42 years old. She lives with her spouse, who helps her in the business, and her 17-year-old daughter.
She reports that she owns a small grocery store and that, in order to get the business started, she and her spouse had to go to Asunción to work as housekeepers. Thanks to their efforts and hard work, they saved money which they used to set up their business. Thanks to their enterprising spirit, they have been able to keep growing. Nowadays it is one of the most popular stores in town, thanks to how attentive and friendly the owners are.
She requests the loan in order to purchase noodles, rice, sugar, beverages, etc., for stocking up her store. She thanks the Fundación and Kiva for the opportunity she is given.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, rice, sugar, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Rebelita

texts.en:
Rebelita is 49, married and has three school-age children. Due to financial difficulties, she helps her husband in managing their corn farming business for it is the main source of their income. Despite the hardships in farming, they are strong enough to face whatever challenges they encounter in life. 

They aim to increase their yields and income to be able to support the education of their children and satisfy their basic necessities. In this regard, Rebelita is asking for an additional capital of P25,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and to pay labor cost required in corn planting. They believed that through patience and hard work, they will have a fruitful harvest. They hope that in the future they will improve their status of living and give their children a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost required in corn planting.

loans.name: Oyunzul

texts.en:
Oyunzul is 44 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Dornod province of Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business, and her son is a student. 

Oyunzul started her grocery shop business in 1997 by renting a counter in a market. Her customers are increasing rapidly due to the many buildings being constructed in the area. Therefore, Oyunzul is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy supplies. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "Now that my customers have increased, I believe it is my chance to expand my business."

loans.use: to buy more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI sont essentiellement des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à MAMASSONI, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
MARIAM, la première assise à droite, fait le commerce de pagnes wax et bazin, il y’a environ  3 ans.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 8 pièces de pagnes wax et 2 pièces de bazin. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes au grand marché de Sikasso ville.  Elle les revend en détail (de un à trois pagnes) de façon ambulante marché et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The seven members of the SINIGNESSIGUI group are essentially married women with an average age of 42; an average of 3 children; and who, for the most part, live in monogamous families in MAMASSONI, one of the outlying districts of the city of Sikasso.

This is the group’s first loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution that will be used to meet the needs of their customers. 

MARIAM, the first woman seated on the right, has been selling pagnes and damask for about 3 years. With her loan, she is planning to buy 8 panges and 2 pieces of damask. 

She buys her supplies from wholesalers at the grand market of the city of Sikasso. She resells them at retail (from one to three pagnes) for cash, both on foot and out of her home, to a clientele of both men and women.

She plans on earning average monthly profits of 17,500 FCFA - some of which will be used to pay the loan and its interest, and the rest of which will go into savings. She would like to increase her earnings to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy pagnes and damask

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Gemma has a shop that sells seedlings of trees like gemilina (beech) and mahogany. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizers for the seedlings. Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her seedlings.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is married and has two daughters aged six months and three years. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. She runs a beauty salon and provides services of plaiting, blow-drying and applying chemicals. In addition, she sells cosmetics and hair oils. Her business challenge is the high prices of cosmetics. She will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to purchase more beauty products. In the next five years, Catherine hopes to run a cosmetics retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Dinah's Group

texts.en:
Dinah's group is formed by 13 farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Dinah, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 27 years old, is married and has three children. Dinah has been a farmer for 15 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Dinah isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Dinah will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Dinah's group will purchase a total of 13 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: El señor Santos es casado y tiene 4 hijos, estudio hasta tercer grado pero antes de empezar a estudiar Santos trabajaba con su padre en labores de agricultura. El señor Santos trabaja actualmente en una finca de un señor, trabaja junto con su esposa sembrando granos básicos y ordeñan vacas, dos de sus hijos menores están estudiando los mayores ya trabajan. El señor Santos apoya mucho a sus hijos en los estudios para que sean personas preparadas. Con mucho esfuerzo el señor Santos a ido mejorando poco a poco su casa, pero en la comunidad donde vive no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar el cual será de gran beneficio para toda la familia. El señor Santos les agradece de antemano por la oportunidad que le puedan brindar en este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.

loans.use: Sistema Solar de 65 Watts con 4 luminarias instalado.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: tO EXPAND HER FARMING BUSINESS

loans.name: Toyibah

texts.en: T. is 24 years old and married with one child aged 3. She sells fruit-flavored blended ice in front of her house. She usually earns a profit of $1.50 per day. Her husband, Sukron, is a fisherman whose income is unpredictable, ranging between $2 - $3 per day.  She very much needs to have this $50 loan to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Fruit-flavored blended ice

loans.name: Adjo Georgette

texts.en:
Miss S. Adjo Georgette was born in 1979 in Lomé. She is single. She is a master hairdresser with a dozen apprentices. She supports her parents, brothers and sisters. After graduating first of her class, Georgette opened up a shop under a shed by the side of a road where she brilliantly practices her job. Despite the number of her apprentices, Miss S. is not anymore able to satisfy her customers because of lack of adequate equipment and the tightness of her shop. To establish her customer loyalty and to increase their number, she imperatively needs to open up another shop and to equip it by buying hairdryers, shampoos and others modern products. To do so requires financial means that she does not have. Therefore, she is soliciting a $1200 loan that she will pay back with her income which will triple with the acquisition of the projected equipment.

Translated from [French] by [Bijou Kuzimbu], Kiva Volunteer.

Mlle S. Adjo Georgette est née en 1979 à Lomé. Célibataire, elle est maîtresse coiffeuse ayant sous sa responsabilité une dizaine d’apprenties et à sa charge ses parents et ses jeunes frère et sœurs. Sortie première de sa promotion, Mlle S. a ouvert son atelier sous un hangar au bord de la route où elle exerce avec brio son métier. Très appréciée et sollicitée, Mlle S. malgré le nombre pléthorique de ses apprenties n’arrive plus à satisfaire toutes ses clientes faute de moyens matériels plus adapté et de l’exiguïté de l’atelier. Aujourd’hui pour fidéliser sa clientèle et en augmenter, elle a besoin impérativement d’ouvrir un autre atelier, l’équiper en achetant des séchoirs, des laves têtes et d’autres produits plus modernes. Cela nécessite des moyens financiers dont elle ne dispose pas, c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $1200 qu’elle pourra rembourser à partir de ses recettes qui auront à tripler avec les aménagements et l’acquisition des matériels prévus.

loans.use:
Open a shop and equip it 
(Ouvrir un atelier et l'équiper)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her shoe shop

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en: Muhamed is a forty seven year old carpenter.  He makes beds and school benches and other furniture that clients request. Married with five children, he used his previous loan to buy needed tools for his craft. The tools enabled him to improve the quality of production.  He is requesting a loan of $350 to buy timber and employ one carpenter to assist him.  Muhamed said, with the loan, he will be able to keep up with contracts and increase his profit.

loans.use: Purchase timber for increased production and hire an assistant carpenter.

loans.name: Rangel

texts.en: Rangel K. lives in the village in Medkovetz, near Vratza. He has a farm with eight cows near the house in which he and his wife live. He and his wife are unemployed; consequently, this farming business is their family's only source of income. Rangel needs $750 so that he can buy one more cow for his farm.

loans.use: Purchasing one more cow for his farm

loans.name: Malickkosim

texts.en: Malickkosim Z. lives in Mastchokh and he is married with two children. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004 and he recommends himself as a serious and executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. He is engaged in commercial and trade service. Mr. Z. has a business in rice selling. He is the direct supplier which allows him to sell the rice by a price that is lower than the bazaar price. He is very polite which is why he has permanent clients who want to buy only his goods. Malickkosim Z. is very experienced in his business. But working in the trade sphere he meets hard competitors which is why he wants to widen his existing assortment. Now Mr. Z. requires a loan of 4100 STJ to develop his business and widen his assortment of goods  to increase the family's income that allows his children to continue their education.

loans.use: Malickkosim would like to develop his rice selling business so he can continue to send his children to school.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a salon stylist; she does hair in different styles for people in her community. She is married with four children. She is 38 years old. She needs the loan of $450 to enable her buy weavon (hair-weaving product) and other hair accessories and drinks to sell. She learned the business for 2 years and started this one in 1995.

loans.use: To buy more hair accessories and drinks

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia Benítez de Silva is a 45 year old mother of four children and has been married to her husband Justo for 20 years. In order to provide income for her family, Celia has worked on the street as a newspaper vendor. She works on a very important avenue in the city where she lives. In order to increase her profits, she began working with Fundación Paraguaya to buy new goods.

Now Celia is making more income selling fruits along with her newspapers. With the initial loan from the Fundación, she was able to invest in fruits and newspapers toprovide to people who walk or drive along the busy avenues where she works. The loan she is asking for today will be used to invest more money into fresh local fruits including watermelon, plums, apples and bananas to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fruits including bananas, apples, watermelon, and plums.

loans.name: Wanyange Lake K D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Miriam N.. She is currently in the business of selling raw food and is requesting a loan to purchase a bicycle to transport the food from the villages to her stall. Miriam is 31 years old and is married with a husband who is an egg supplier for work. She has 6 children ranging from ages 4 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Miriam makes approximately UGX 45000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children. Miriam has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 350000 in order to buy more raw food and the loan was paid back on time.

Miriam is joined in her small group by Ester N., Robina T. and Muselina M.. Ester N. has a business selling raw food and wants to rent bigger business premises. Robina T. is currently operating a grocery store business and wants a loan to purchase more groceries. Muselina M. operates a charcoal and scrap selling business and wants to buy more scrap to sell.

loans.use: To add to raw food business

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
Mrs. Lili is a member of the Indo American Community Bank, located at Av. Amazon, Lt. F Block 20, Calleria District, Ucayali State. She is 43 years old, married, and has eight children. Her husband is a trader.

With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) of approximately $110, Lili started a business selling food. At present, she has a restaurant. She gets up at 6 am to go to the market and buy the ingredients for preparing the dishes that she sells from noon to 2 pm. With this loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, Lili plans to buy: 1 large sack of rice, 1 large sack of sugar, noodles, oil, etc.

Lili is very glad that she can support her children with their studies as well as contribute to the household expenses. She is very grateful for the support Manuela Ramos provides for her business.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Lili pertenece al Banco Comunal Indo América, ubicado en la Av. Amazonas, Mz F Lt 20, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años y es madre de 8 hijos, su esposo es comerciante Lili con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de comida. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un restaurante, se levanta a las 6 am para ir al mercado y comprar sus productos para preparar sus comidas que los vende desde el medio día hasta las 2 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, fideos, aceite, etc. Lili esta muy feliz y satisfecha, por que puede apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y también aporta a los gastos familiares y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for the preparation of restaurant food

loans.name: Pedro Joaquín

texts.es:
Mr. Gamez is a 48-year-old married father of 4 underage children. He lives in Unidad de Propósito, a neighborhood in the city of Managua.

Mr. Gamez has owned a snack bar, which he started with his own money, for 15 years. For a few months now, he has been having some difficulties running his business due to power outages in his neighborhood. Because of this problem, he has experienced drops in his sales.

He wants to use this loan to stock up on the products necessary to satisfy his customers’ needs. His future plans are to expand his business and sell other products, to prepare his children, and to live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Pedro tiene 48 años de edad, habita en Unidad de Propósito un barrio de la ciudad de Managua, es casado y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales dos son menores de edad.

Don Pedro tiene un cafetín desde hace quince años, este negocio lo llevó a cabo con dinero propio. Desde hace algunos meses atrás debido a los cortes de luz en el lugar en el que habita ha tenido muchas dificultades, ya que ha tenido que cerrar temprano su negocio, es por eso que ha experimentado algunas bajas en sus ventas.

El dinero del préstamo lo quiere para invertir en capital de trabajo y abastecer de todos los productos necesarios para sastifacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Sus planes futuros son ampliar el negocio y vender otros artículos, preparar a sus hijos y vivir más cómodos.

loans.use: Purchase supplies needed to run a snack bar

loans.name: Tutiniso

texts.en:
Tutiniso B. has been an active client of the MicroInvest since 2003. The stability of her business and income helped her to repay her previous loan promptly. She started her business practically from scratch, and she now sells eggs in the central bazaar. She has many repeat customers because by working directly with suppliers she is able to offer highly competitive prices.

Now Mrs. B. is applying to KIVA for a business support loan of $350 US for 4 months to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mr. Ros S., 36, is a motorcycle taxi driver while his wife is a housewife. They have three children and live in Chamkar Samrong Village, Battambang Province. Two of their children are bricklayers and their income can help to defray the family’s iving expenses. Because his motorcycle is old, Ros S. cannot attract many customers, so now he is asking for a loan to change his motorcycle. The loan will allow him to attract more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To change his motorcycle

loans.name: Darcy Catherina

texts.es:
Darcy is a member of the Banco Comunal Buena Suerte community bank.

Darcy is married, is 37 years old and has 2 children. Darcy sells clothing, shoes, bedding and whatever her clients ask for. She carries out her sales on credit to factory workers, friends, and family. She collects her payments monthly or bi-weekly. She acquires her products in the city of Lima. Darcy also sells naturopathic products such as creams, oils, and other products for women in the area, selling to friends, family and companies.

Darcy requests a loan in the amount of 3000 soles. These funds will be invested in the purchase of slacks, shirts, jackets and polo shirts.

Darcy's dreams is to have a small exporting business for her naturopathic products, and to improve her businesses and consequently provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Darcy es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.

Darcy es casada, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Darcy vende ropa, calzados, edredones y todo cuanto le piden sus clientes, sus ventas son al crédito y ofrece a trabajadores de instituciones, amigos, familiares, los cobros lo realiza cada fin de mes o quincenal, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Darcy vende productos naturales como cremas, aceite, mates, entre otros productos que son producidos por mujeres organizadas de la zona, sus ventas lo realiza a amigos, familiares y en instituciones.

Darcy necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, casacas, chompas, polos.

Los sueños de Darcy son tener una microempresa de exportación de productos naturales, mejorar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Darcy requests a loan in the amount of 3000 soles.  These funds will be invested in the purchase of slacks, shirts, jackets, and polo shirts.

loans.name: Ana Jacinta

texts.es:
Ana, D. 40 años D. edad, socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Asunción D. Carhuaz”, espera tener un restaurante más amplio donD. pueda atender a más clientes, ya que tiene L. ayuda D. su esposo como cocinero y el apoyo D. sus 5 hijos adolescentes.

DesD. hace 6 años, el restaurante “Las Delicias” sirve a diversos comensales en L. ciudad D. Carhuaz, departamento D. Ancash y es  atendido por los hijos D. Ana, quienes cumplen labores D. meseros.

Con el préstamo D. S/ 200, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará sacos D. arroz,  y D. azúcar, 1 caja D. aceite y con lo demás pagará L. academia preuniversitaria D. su segundo hijo.
texts.en:
Ana is 40 years old and is a member of the community bank “Virgen D. Asunción D. Carhuaz”. She hopes to have a bigger restaurant where she would be able to serve more clients. She already has a restaurant with the help of her spouse as a chef and the help of her five adolescent children. For the past 6 years, the restaurant “Las Delicias” has served diverse food in the city of Carhuaz, in the department of Ancash. It is attended by Ana’s children, who work as waiters. With this loan of S/ 200, which she would repay in 4 months, she would buy sacks of rice and sugar, 1 box of oil and with the rest she would pay for a college-prep academy for her second son.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.ru:
Абдучалил парень 1985 года рождения , не женат работает электриком на фабрике.В свободное время в выходные дни занимается уходом и откормом крупнорогатого скота. По мимо его ему в доме помогают его отец- пенсионер.
В момент мониторинга Абдучалил отсутствовал и мне пришлось сфотографировать его отца который занимался уходом за скотом. Абдучалил решил обратится в Микроинвест для расширения своего бизнеса животноводства.
texts.en:
Abdujalil is a guy who was born in 1985. Unmarried, he works as a factory electrician. In his free time on his days off, he cares for and feeds large-horned cattle. His retired father lives with him and helps out. Abdujalil was away at this time of the visit, so the author had to photograph his father, who (also) cares for the cattle. Abdujalil decided to apply to MicroInvest (for a loan) to expand his livestock business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening of cattle

loans.name: Aniratu

texts.en:
Aniratu lives in Agege, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells chickens and ducks in the market. Aniratu has been in this business for a long time. With her experience in this business she has been able to maintain a good communication with her customers, thereby retaining them.

Aniratu is 52 years old and married with 6 children. Aniratu is a LAPO client, and needs a loan to buy more ducks and chickens to sell. She is grateful to Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and ducks to sell

loans.name: Ynes Altagracia  Mariano De Los Santos's Group
loans.use: To buy some crates of beers to add to her store.

loans.name: Mukaramakhon

texts.en:
Mukaramakhon describes herself as a enterprising girl with the goal to achieve successes in the future. She decided to start a sewing business to help her family with household expenses a year ago. She started out helping a woman who ran a tailoring shop. Being very nimble, she learned tailoring and soon began running her own business at the tailoring shop. It has gone very well since then, and she has been able to grow the business.

Mukaramakhon is requesting a loan of $600 USD to purchase materials so she can fulfill her customers' requests. The end of the year is fast approaching, and that is when demand is at its highest. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months. Mukaramakhon and her family are very grateful for your support in helping grow this business and move ahead.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and the birthplaces of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher, Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today it remains a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war that ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

About IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase materials for sewing national dresses

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: El señor Joaquín T. tiene una barbería en la capital de Guatemala ya tiene 8 años en este trabajo, mucha gente ya lo conoce en su colonia y conocen el trabajo que el desempeña, el es soltero y asiste a una iglesia cristiana donde ya lleva 10 años de asistir. El sueña con comprar una silla giratoria y tener un trabajador en su local para poder crecer como empresario y estar mejor económicamente  ya que el primer préstamo le ayudo bastante el espera en Dios que este préstamo también yo ayude mucho en su negocio.
texts.en:
Joaquin T. owns a barbershop in the capital of Guatemala and has been working as a barber for the past 8 years. Many people in his neighborhood already know him and the work that he carries out. He is single and attends a Christian church that he has attended for the past 10 years. He dreams of purchasing a revolving chair and having an employee in his shop so that he may be able to grow as a businessman; he also dreams of being in a better economic situation. Given that his first loan helped him greatly, he hopes to God that this loan will also help him a great deal in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase furnishings and equipment for his barbershop.

loans.name: Emile

texts.fr: Emile K. est propriétaire d’un pressing à Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Il opère dans ce secteur depuis 6 ans et souhaite avec ce crédit acheter un nouvel appareil à laver pour rendre un service plus prompt à la clientèle. Ce faisant, il gagnera plus la confiance de sa clientèle et ceci va lui permettre d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires et par conséquent ses profits. Dans la vue il est assis à l’extrême gauche à coté de l’une de ses employés
texts.en:
Emile K. is the owner of a cleaner's in Lomé, the capital of Togo. He has been active in this sector for 6 years and hopes with this loan to buy a new washing machine so that he can provide prompter service to his clientele. In this way, he will gain the confidence of his clientele and this will allow him to increase his sales and thus his profits. In the photo he is seated on the far left, beside one of his employees.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying a new washing machine

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a clothing and bag seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to Makunguru group loan (Group code 2004).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $105. She works 12 hours a day at her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothing and bags for her business. She hopes that with this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Grace is 42 years old, widowed, and has five children. She also cares for five additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and bags for her business.

loans.name: Yaovi Éric

texts.fr: Monsieur S. yaovi éric a appris la couture, il a ouvert  son atelier de couture qu’il appelle « CHEZ ERIC LE ROI », il a commencé ce commerce depuis 1988 et il vend aussi des articles de mercerie, ce qui fait qu’il a une importante clientèle, actuellement son matériel de travail est vétuste, il a besoin d’un crédit pour renouveler son matériel de travail  ainsi avec ce nouveau crédit il achètera 01 machine à coudre, 01 sous compteur et des articles de mercerie. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. S. Yaovi Eric learned how to sew clothing. He opened a tailor’s shop he calls “CHEZ ERIC LE ROI”. He started this business in 1988, and he also sells supplies of the trade. As a result, he has a sizable number of customers. Right now, his equipment is antiquated. He needs a loan to renew his equipment. Thus, with this new loan, he will buy a sewing machine, a metering device, and tailoring supplies. He is married and the father of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a metering device and tailoring supplies

loans.name: Pascazia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Pascalia F. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children between the ages of 1 and 9. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents cannot take care of them. 

Pascalia has been running a clothes business since 2006. She works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, seven days a week. Pascalia currently earns about US $200 from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase stock in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Pascazia thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock of clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Suliat

texts.en:
Suliat is a fashion designer and she also sells school sandals. She is 38 years old and married to K. who is also a fashion designer. They have two children.

Suliat is requesting the loan of N140,000 to purchase more school sandals to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more school sandals to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros sells snacks in the high school building just beside her house. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase more goods and snacks to sell at her school vending business. She also sells ready-made food and vegetables to some of the other villagers. According to her, she is able to earn around PHP 3,000 a month and uses it to provide her family with necessities. Milagros hopes to become financially stable and she wished her family will always be healthy.

“Only those who are diligent will survive” shared Milagros; this has been her main principle in life. She is 60 years old and is married to a farmer, Antonio A.. They live in the peaceful village of San Lorenzo Ilagan, Isabela and they are blessed with five children; Elito, Edwin, Evelyn, Emelyn, and Marilyn. Milagros feels lucky to have her children who are very supportive and responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris G. is 43 years old and a married mother with three kids. All the kids are currently in school. She says selling of lingerie, jewelry, and slippers, especially for women, is very profitable and therefore she has been selling ladies' lingerie, slippers, jewelry, and clothes in the local market for two years to help her husband take care of the family’s needs.

With the loan, Doris wants to buy bales of lingerie, slippers, clothes and jewelry to increase her inventory and sales for good income. She believes this loan would help her save some money to start paying part of the children's school fees and the utility bills. She is a member of the group called ‘Nkunimde’ which means victory.

loans.use: To buy bales of lingerie, jewelry, slippers etc.

loans.name: Sergio Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Sergio Alberto vive con su esposa y familia; el labora como supervisor en una empresa desde hace 8 años. 
Son una familia estable y unida hacia un mismo objetivo que es “lograr un mejor estilo de vida “. Ellos por el momento están solicitando este crédito para la colocación de protecciones en la puerta delantera y la puerta trasera de su hogar, para mayor protección de la familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Sergio Alberto lives with his wife and family. He has been working as a supervisor at an enterprise for 8 years. They are a stable and united family with the goal "to achieve a better life style". At the moment they are requesting this loan to place protections for the front and back doors of their home, in order to improve the security of the family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Place protections for front and back doors.

loans.name: Nyame Asem Group

texts.en:
Kwasi is thirty-two years old. He is married and has four children. He is a petty trader. He runs a provisions store.
