Kwasi is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame Asem’ which literally means God’s Word. He is the only male in the group photograph. The members of this group are mostly petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. They work to support their spouses to provide for their families.

They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell them at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting for a loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses.

The members of the group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children a good education.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Coumba Gédou

texts.fr: La dame Coumba Gédou S. est âgée de 53ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de produits cosmétiques. Les revenus générés lui permettent d’assurer à ses enfants une scolarité, une bonne santé et de meilleures conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Coumba Gedou S. is 53 years old, married and mother to 10 children. She is in the cosmetics business. The revenues generated allow her to ensure her children an education, good health and a better quality of life.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Crane Group

texts.en:
Fredy R., age 35, is widower with three children ages 8, 4 and 2 years. He has a hardware business that he started 5 years ago. He works daily from 8am until 6pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $228.
 
This will be R.’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He hopes to get a loan to increase his hardware stock.
	
R. will share this loan with his loan group, Crane Group, which has 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, R. is 2nd from left at the back.

loans.use: Increase his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat des pièces détachées de motos

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites G. is from the village of Malangka, Gingoog City, in the Philippines. She is twenty-four years-old and married with three young children. Marites owns and operates a mini-restaurant called a "carenderia". While not the only revenue generator, the main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to local customers. Marites has run her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from it.

In 2009, Marites joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marites from HSPFI. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the business as a reserve for future emergencies.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drink for a restaurant

location.town: Malangka, Barangay 25, Gingoog City, Misamis Orien

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa es una mujer muy alegre de 33 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 8 hijos, en su casa. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, también tiene algunos cultivos, pero aunque estos no le brindan muchas ganancia logra suplir sus necesidades diarias. Por ello, adicionalmente a su siembra plátanos y café, atiende su tienda desde las 5 de la tarde, donde recibe muy amablemente a sus clientes,  ya que gracias a ellos su negocio va creciendo poco a poco. Pero el anhelo de Teresa es trasladarse  a una  zona más poblada, donde sus ganancias se incrementen. Bajo esa mira, su esposo también trabaja arduamente como jornalero, ganando diariamente 18 soles y algunas veces usan ese dinero como capital de la tienda. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y en su crédito anterior nunca se retrasó en los pagos, por lo contrario, es muy puntual y asiste a todas las reuniones de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en el incremento de mercadería de su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Teresa is a very happy 33 year old woman. She lives with her life partner and father of their eight children in her house. For two years she has been selling groceries. She also has some crops. Even though these do not provide much income, she is able to provide the daily necessities. To do so, she has added banana and coffee plants. She works in her store from five in the afternoon. She very kindly welcomes her customers. Thanks to them, the business is growing little by little. But, Teresa’s wish is to move to a more populated area where her earnings will increase. Her husband also works arduously as a day laborer. He earns 18 soles daily, and sometimes they use this money as capital for the store. This is her second loan with MFP, and she was never late with her payments on her previous loan. To the contrary, she is very punctual and goes to all of her communal bank meetings. The money she is now asking for is to increase merchandise in her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Mable's Group

texts.en:
K. Mable is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is 56 years old and married with nine children, and she takes care of two more dependents. Mable is a business lady who has been selling hides and skins from Ibanda town for 12 years. 

Out of her transactions, Mable is able to make 400,000 UGX in profit a month, which helps to take care of her family with feeding, medical care, clothing and school fees. She has been successful because of her quality products that attract as many customers as possible -- even those from Kampala, which is about 300 kilometers away. 

She has a dream of expanding her business further by putting in more capital, hence increasing profit as well as having a happy family. Mable is a very hard-working lady and she needs a loan to help increase her business volume for more returns.

loans.use: Buying more hides and skins for her business expansion.

loans.name: 21 De Enero Group

texts.es: El grupo "21 D. Enero" esta representado por la señora Marianela y conformada por 12 socias D. las cuales un 50 % son profesionales que desarrollan actividades comerciales como la venta D. ropa juvenil, perfumes, joyas, una D. las socia tiene su salón D. belleza y el socio participante venD. productos varios al por mayor, es un buen vendedor porque cortantemente está en contacto con sus clientes para no perder su mercado D. venta, la presidenta venD. joyas D. plata y joyas bañadas en oro, es una buena vendedora ya que las joyas las venD. a crédito  o al contado; todas se conocen hace tiempo y tienen una estima muy especial entre ellas, tienen muchas expectativas para el futuro D. mejorar y seguir creciendo más cada día por el bien D. sus familias. En el ámbito comercial la competencia es alta, pero año tras año las socias luchan para tener un ingreso diario que sustente a su familia. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mayor mercadería para ampliar sus tiendas y también para la compra D. puestos fijos. . A pesar D. ser su primer ciclo los socios ya cuenta con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a entidades financieras similares a la Fundación Agocapital con la cual se encuentran agradecidos por la confianza y el apoyo económico brindado.
texts.en:
The group "21 D. Enero" (January 21st) has twelve members and is represented by Sra. Marianela. Fifty percent of the members are merchants selling children clothes, perfumes and jewelry. One of the members has a beauty salon. Another member sells different wholesale products. He is in constant contact with his clients in order not to lose his market; he is a great salesperson. The group’s president sells silver and gold plated jewelry. She gives her clients the option to pay by cash or in installments; she is a great businesswoman. They have all known each other for a long time and have a special affection towards each other. For the sake of their families’ future, they have high expectations for the future growth of their businesses.
There is high competition in their businesses, but year after year the group members have worked hard to ensure they sell enough to support their families.
This loan will be used to buy merchandise to expand their businesses and to buy a retail space. Although this is their first loan, they have a lot of experience with other communal banks thanks to other financial institutions similar to Fundación AgroCapital. They are thankful for the trust and financial support that Fundacion AgroCapital has given them.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djiguissèmè sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 37 ans et 4 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles exercent le commerce  d’articles divers pour aider leur mari. Ces femmes ont intégrés  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. 
Elles sont leur premier prêt de groupe avec l’institution. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, une grande quantité de fruits et légumes et  beaucoup d’articles divers. Les articles divers sont achetés à Bamako et les fruits et légumes sont achetés sur place et dans les villages  environnants. Elles vendent  sur place à Dioïla à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 49 900FCFA par personne. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Djiguissèmè Group are married women, with an average age of 37 and 4 children. They live together with their husbands and their children in large traditional families in the city of Dioïla, District of Dioïla, in the region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali. They met each other through family and neighborhood connections. To help their husbands, they have a retail business and sell various products. These women have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, hoping to improve their business. With this first loan, they intend to buy a considerable amount of fruits and vegetables, as well as several other products. They buy all these different items in Bamako, while fruits and vegetables come from their own neighborhood. Their customers are men and women of their hometown, Dioïla.

They aim to achieve an individual monthly profit of 49 900FCFA. Part of this profit will be invested in their business, the rest will be used to provide for the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables and other products

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.en:
Ignacio P. is from the village of Sta Rosa. He is 41 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ignacio owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing electrical repairs in the local community. Ignacio has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.
Ignacio joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide his services. This loan will be his sixth from ASKI. Ignacio plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to pay his children's tuition fees.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide his services

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en: Ernesto P. is from the city of San Luis, Tarlac. He is 42 years old. Ernesto is single. To make a living, Ernesto owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services in the local community. Ernesto has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Ernesto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ernesto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Ernesto is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide his service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ernesto from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Miss. Socheat Y., 29, is single and lives with her mother, sisters and brothers on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Socheat has been a silk weaver for five years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market.

The house where Socheat lives is old and broken down, so she decided to build a new one. But, she doesn’t have money to pay to build it. Hence, she is asking for her first loan of US$1,000 for this purpose.

loans.use: To pay for house construction

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina D. is a 24-year-old mother of a two-year-old child and a wife of a 27-year-old construction worker. While she still has only one small child, she wants to invest in growing a business so that by the time her family has grown she will have the finances in place to support it. 

Aside from the food selling business which she had started through her previous loans from ASHI, Gina now wants another loan for an additional business which is pig fattening. 

With this kind of business, Gina can maximize her time at home while taking care of her two-year-old child. After four months of fattening her pig, she can sell it either alive or slaughter it and sell its pork per kilo in the neighborhood. The profit with this is not much but is fair enough. But once a large volume of pigs are fattened and sold at one time, the profit would be as much as double its capital and this is what Gina envisions.

loans.use: Piglets for a pig fattening business

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en:
Aydin J. is a 43-year-old trader who sells furniture in the small village of Agsu city. He is married and has four children who are the meaning of his life.

Aydin has ten years of experience in selling furniture. He wishes to save money to provide his children with an education. He needs to invest in his shop and purchase more furniture and for this purpose he applied for 1,600 AZN.

loans.use: To purchase more furniture to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to use for commuting

loans.name: Carmen Patricia

texts.es:
Carmen Patricia D. G. se dedica tanto a la venta por catálogo de ropa masculina y femenina, de perfumes y de accesorios, como a la elaboración de bolsos, blusas, manteles y tejidos en hilo. Tiene 34 años y vive con sus dos hijos varones de 6 y 9 años en la Ciudadela 20 de Julio en Barranquilla, un barrio que presenta una combinación de zonas comerciales y residenciales; en este barrio encontramos centros comerciales, supermercados, el Estadio Metropolitano de fútbol, estaderos, tabernas y múltiples conjuntos residenciales de edificios y casas.
Carmen inició su negocio en el año 2000 cuando una vecina le enseñó a tejer y todavía trabajaba como impulsadora en almacenes de Barranquilla. El nacimiento de su hijo en el 2001 la obligó a dejar de laborar como empleada y a dedicarse a la crianza del bebé. La mayoría de sus clientes son vecinos, amigos, familiares y recomendados; aunque  hay bastante competencia, se sostiene por la calidad de su servicio  y los precios que ofrece; ella cada 21 días compra productos por catálogo y también  otras mercancías que no tienen los catálogos, pero siempre lo hace  sobre pedido. Ha tenido 3 préstamos anteriores con la Fundación que le ha permitido aumentar sus ingresos y educar a sus hijos. Con este crédito,  por valor de  $ 1.500.000 que ahora solicita, quiere invertirlo en la compra de mercancías por catálogo como ropa, perfumes, accesorios, hilos al por mayor y de contado y además, planifica comprar maniguetas de madera y piedras ornamentales. Carmen dice que su mayor desafío es la falta de capital de trabajo y la falta de una casa propia; más adelante, sueña con comprarla y expandir su negocio con los créditos que les otorga la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.
texts.en:
Carmen Patricia D. G. sells merchandise through catalogs such as men’s and women’s clothing, perfumes, and accessories. She also produces hand-knitted purses, blouses, tablecloths, and fabrics. Carmen is 34 years old and has two sons, ages 6 and 9. She lives in the July 20th neighborhood of Barranquilla, which is a mixture of business and residential areas. In this neighborhood, you will find shopping centers, supermarkets, the metropolitan soccer stadium, inns, taverns, and numerous residential buildings and houses.

Carmen started her business in 2000 when a neighbor taught her how to knit. She was still working as a salesperson at a department store in Barranquilla. The birth of her son in 2001 forced her to quit her job so that she could dedicate herself to taking care of her baby. Her customers consist of neighbors, friends, relatives, and people who have been recommended to her. Although there is significant competition, she maintains her clientele because of the quality of her service and the prices she offers. Every 21 days, she places orders for her catalog products and also purchases items that are not found in the catalogs but are frequently requested. She has had three previous loans with the Foundation that have enabled her to increase her income and educate her children.

With this loan of 1,500,000 COP that she requested, Carmen will invest in the purchase of catalog merchandise such as clothing, perfumes, accessories, as well as wholesale yarn for cash. She also plans to buy wooden utensils and ornaments made of stone. Carmen says her biggest challenges are the lack of operating capital and not having her own home. Sometime later, she dreams of buying a house and expanding her business with the loans provided by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, perfumes, accessories, yarn, wooden utensils, and stone ornaments

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Ángel SalI. O., es trabajador de la escuela Marcos Dessys  de Chinandega se desempeña como maestro de primaria es soltero sin hijos y aun está estudiando en la Universidad.

El señor Miguel Ángel SalI. O., solicito el crédito para pagar su matrícula  en la Universidad y para materiales  de estudio.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel SalI. O. works at Marcos Dessys School in Chinadega. He is a primary school teacher. He is single without children. He is even taking university classes. Miguel Ángel SalI. O. is asking for a loan to pay for his university registration fees and study materials.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: University registration fees and study materials

loans.name: Dominic Kiguta

texts.en:
Dominic is 33 years old and married to Esther, who is a businesswoman. They are blessed with two children: a son aged four years and a daughter aged two years.

Dominic is a tailor by profession and he has been in the tailoring business for the past six years. He has applied for a loan to purchase fabric for making curtains, since there is high demand for them. He will also use his loan to restock different fabrics, so clients will have a larger selection. He also needs to add a sewing machine and create employment for someone else to help him. With the extra profit expected from the business, he intends to open a tailoring school to train others .
 
Dominic hopes to expand his clothing business and export his own clothes. He describes himself as a hard-working business man who is focused and ambitious.

loans.use: To purchase fabric for curtains and add another sewing machine

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar forma parte del banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO”,  tiene  56 años, tiene dos hijas y es docente jubilado. Su principal actividad económica es hacer servicios de moto taxi. Ya son dos años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Julio Cesar es una persona, responsable y emprendedor que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia. Julio Cesar requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del moto taxi comprará repuestos y llantas. El socio es presidente de “La Asociación de Moto Taxi Valle Sagrado” que está conformado por 76 socios. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is a member of the “VALLE SAGRADO” (“Sacred Valley”) communal bank. He is a retired teacher who is 56 years old and has two daughters. His main economic activity is providing a moto taxi service. He has made a living from this business for two years and it is going very well. Julio Cesar is a very responsible and enterprising man who spends every moment looking for opportunities to get ahead and makes an effort every day to help his family. Julio Cesar needs a loan so that he can do maintenance work on his moto taxi, and will use the money to purchase spare parts and tires. He is president of the “Valle Sagrado Moto Taxi Association”, an organization that has 76 members. Julio Cesar is grateful for the opportunity he is being given through this loan, and he agrees to complete all of his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance work on his moto taxi.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines), Pakistan, is the wife of G. M. and the mother of two sons. The elder son works in a factory on monthly wage and the younger one operates a flower shop where he sells fresh flowers. 
A very caring lady, Khalida stays at home to cook food for her family. She cooks food on time and presents it to her family and manages the household chores efficiently. Her husband is involved in a construction supplies selling business. He specifically sells cement to customers because of the high demand from his customers. He has been doing this work for over twenty years.  
Khalida has successfully completed two loans to Asasah. With the loan profit she bought a color television and a bicycle for her son. Now she is applying for the third time to invest the capital in her husband’s business so that he can purchase the cement in bulk and complete the orders of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase cement to complete the customer's orders.

loans.name: Asinio

texts.es: Asinio tiene 29 años, es un joven muy trabajador y responsable, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. Los largos días de trabajo que Asinio realiza en su chacra tanto de café, maíz y achiote, le han servido para obtener los ingresos económicos que necesita para mantenerse. Todas las mañanas sale en dirección a sus cultivos para cuidarlos y trabajarlos, ya que sabe que así obtendrá una cosecha de buena calidad. Lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras. Con el tiempo espera mejorar la calidad de sus productos, fertilizando mejor sus tierras. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro en el futuro. En su grupo comunal, es un socio muy querido, ya que es el más joven del grupo. Con los mil seiscientos nuevos soles que solicita, contratará peones, para que limpien y trabajen sus tierras.
texts.en:
Asinio is 29 years old. He is a very hard-working and responsible young man. He lives in his own house, and what he most desires is to be outstanding in life. The long days of work that Asinio puts in on his farm, where he grows coffee, corn, and achiote, have enabled him to obtain the economic income that he needs to support himself. Every morning he goes out to his crops to take care of them and work on them, since he knows that in this way he will obtain a good quality harvest. He has been doing this work for 11 years, and what he likes most about his work is harvesting his crops, and he considers fumigating his land to be the most difficult task. In time, he hopes to improve the quality of his products by fertilizing his lands better. This is his third loan with MFP, and he knows that he has to make all his payments on time if he wants to be granted another loan in the future. In his community bank, he is a very well-liked member, since he is the youngest in the group. With the 1600 PEN that he is applying for, he will hire workers to clean and work on his land.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: hire workers to help him clean and plow his fields

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita N. is from the village of Pigsag an Cagayan de Oro City. She is 55 years old. Nenita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Nenita runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2008, Nenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Nenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lum

texts.en:
Born in 1956, Lum J. is married to A. John Awah and they have brought forth five children. A woman who does not like to depend on the husband for all the family needs, and finding it so difficult to accomplish this task, Lum J. joined GHAPE in 1998.

She also has been having marital problems which causes her to be sad all the time but she is appreciative of the fact that she is alive. Her desire is to give her children love and education. She states that she feels better each time she provides something small to her children.

Her inability to get investment capital which could consistently generate income for her to meet her children’s needs is what motivated her to obtain a loan from GHAPE.  With her loan she plans to buy a two-wheel motorcycle. She knows this business will succeed because she is located at a good business site and she is a good rider for the motorcycle.

She plans to use the profits generated to sponsor her children in school and to cater for the basic needs of her family. She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. The first installment repayment shall be done on the fourth month of loan disbursement.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works toward the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.

Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase a two wheel motorcycle.

loans.name: Costa Brava Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Costa Brava se eligió este nombre para este grupo, por L. región D. L. costa D. Pinotepa Nacional, esta historia es acerca del señor Joniy D. L. C. Morales es uno D. los integrantes D. este grupo, el es casado, tiene 30 años es padre D. un niño D. 3 años y es carpintero.

El nos platica que se decidió por este oficio ya que lo aprendió desD. que era niño ya que su papá era carpintero y le heredo las herramientas para que el siguiera trabajando, dice que es un buen negocio ya que se obtienen muy buenos ingresos, el crédito que le otorgaron lo va a invertir en L. compra D. mas materiales para seguir trabajando como: madera, pegamento y pintura. 

Las ganancias que obtiene D. L. venta D. su negocio, le están beneficiando mucho a el y a su familia, ya que ahora están pudiendo tener un poco mas D. solvencia económica y ahora que ya su hijo va a entrar al preescolar y tienen que comprarle su material escolar también le esta ayudando D. mucho. 

Dice que con su negocio esta beneficiando mucho a las personas D. su comunidad ya que no hay muchas carpinterías en L. población y tienen que ir muy lejos para poder encargar lo que necesitan, pero ahora ya no lo que hacen, puesto que tuenen L. carpintería D. Don Joniy  muy cerca.

El propósito que el tiene es ver crecer a su hijo y apoyarlo para que siga estudiando, y pueda tener una carrera y una muy buena profesión, también desea tener una carpintería mas granD.  para apoyar a su mamá, ya que L. señora es viuda y él L. ayuda económicamente y para mejorar su nivel D. vida.

Platica que todos los integrantes D. su grupo, son muy confiables, responsables y trabajadores ya que tienen tiempo D. conocerse.

El señor Joniy da las gracias a FRAC y KIVA por que gracias a ellos ha podido lograr tener su propio negocio y asi cambiar su vida y L. D. su familia.

Los integrantes D. costa brava y las actividades a L. que se dedican son las siguientes:
Joniy D. L. C. Morales-carpintería
Clemencia Marroquín R.-antojitos
Albina D. L. R.-repostería
Nelida Cristina M. C.-repostería
Sixto Ricardo H. S.-carpintería
Gloria López C.-tienda D. ropa
Jacinto Raúl López T.-lavado D. autos
Florentino P.-pescadería
FabioL. Leonarda López Damián-antojitos
Valenta S. Nicolás-tienda D. ropa
texts.en:
The group is called Costa Brava after the region of the National Pinotepa coast. This is the story of Joniy D. L. C. Morales, one of the group members. He is married, 30 years old, the father of a three-year old boy and a carpenter. He explains that he chose this profession because he learned it as a child as his father was a carpenter and left him his tools so he'd be able to work. He says it is a good business that provides him with a good income. He is going to use the loan to invest in the purchase of materials to continue working, including wood, glue and paint. The earnings he is getting out of the business benefit him and his family very much. He is now financially more secure, which is going to help now that his son is starting preschool and they will have to buy school materials for him. He also says that his business is benefitting the community as there aren't many carpenters in the town and people used to have to go far to order what they need. That's no longer the case, as they now have Joiy's carpenter's worshop nearby. His main goal is to see his son grow up and support him through his studies so that he can have a career and a good profession. He would also like a larger workshop to support his mother, who is a widow and whom he helps financially, and to improve his standard of living. He mentions that all group members are very reliable and responsible workers now they have had the chance to know each other. Joniy would like to thank FRAC and KIVA because they have enabled him to own his own business and change his life and his family's. Costa Brava group members and their business activities are: Joniy D. L. C. Morales - carpentry M. Clemencia R. - snacks Albina D. L. R. - confectionery Nelida Cristina M. C. - confectionery Sixto Ricardo H. S. - carpentry Gloria L. C. - clothing store Jacinto Raul L. T. - car wash Florentino Pena -fishmongers FabioL. Leonarda L. D. -snacks Valenta S. N. - clothing store

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood and paint

loans.name: Robert

texts.es: Robert, de 44 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive solo en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo que realiza Robert es el cultivo de Manzanilla, esta actividad le ha dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse, es por eso que todos los días trabaja arduamente en sus sembríos. Él ha visto por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta la ciudad de Tarma, ya que según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas de insectos que pueden amenazar su productividad, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador. Con el tiempo, espera que sus cultivos mejoren y con su venta pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su grupo comunal, en donde es muy querido. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Robert, 44, is a very unassuming, hard working man. He lives alone in his own house and his greatest wish is to improve his quality of life. Robert is a chamomile grower. This activity has provided income sufficient for him to support himself. This is why he works hard every day on his crops. He has deemed it advisable to sell his products all the way in Tarma because, as he states, that is where profits are best. What he enjoys most about his work is caring that his crops are free from insect infestations that can affect yields. He has been in this line of work for 5 years and considers the most trying aspects of it having to transport his crops to market because the journey is long and exhausting. In time, he hopes his crops will improve so that their sales will improve his income. This is his 3rd loan with MFP and he feels obliged to repay on time because he doesn’t want to cause any problems for his fellow group members where he is well liked. He will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy more manure for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more manure.

loans.name: Pantaleon Remigio

texts.es:
Pantaleon de 52 años, es mecánico de autos y vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil.

Empezó desde pequeño como aprendiz de automóviles, cuando creció para poder mantener a su familia y por la falta de oportunidades el tuvo que trabajar desde como mecánico, ubico el taller en la parte delantera de su casa, pero por las lluvias se vuelve muy lodoso porque su casa esta ubicada en una loma. 
 
Con el préstamo quiere comprar filtros y herramientas para su negocio, en el futuro quiere vender aceites para carros y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Pantaleon is 52 years old, a mechanic, and lives in a suburban area called Paraiso de Guayaquil. He began as a mechanic apprentice when he was young. When he grew up, he had to work as a mechanic in order to maintain his family and for the lack of opportunities. His workshop is in the front part his house but the rain has caused it to become very muddy, since it is located on a hill. With this loan, he would like to purchase filters and tools for his business. In the future, he wants to sell oil for cars and better construct his house.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Filters and tools.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Mrs. Heang S. is a 26-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom Province. She is married to Sal Soeun, age 28. This couple, who work together in the farming business, has given birth to a young child who attends school. 

Due to the coming farming season, Heang S. wants to have farm supplies to use on her farmland. As she lacks money to achieve her requirements, Heang S. has decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer and crop seed for planting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and crop seed for planting.

loans.name: Biviana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado  en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Biviana; ella tiene 56 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos como habas, maíz, moraya, frijoles y trigo y también se dedica a cultivar maíz y papa, ya que tiene un pequeño terreno de cultivo, la socia quiere mejorar su terreno. La socia solicita el préstamo para la educación de su hija que se está preparando para ingresar a la universidad.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Biviana, 56, is married and has four children. She is a member of the “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata” communal bank located in Yuncaypata, Cusco province, Cusco department. She alternates her daily chores with the sale of products like lima beans, corn, dehydrated potato, beans and wheat. She also farms corn and potato since she has a small field. She would like to improve her field. She is asking for funds for her daughter’s education since she is getting ready to enroll in the university. She makes use of this forum to thank all those who share her dream and promises to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For her daughter's educational expenses.  She's getting ready to start University.
